Reviews.Title: “Paris First Timers Review Hotel and City.”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from our very first time in Paris.WOW! What city.. Will review the hotel first then the city.. We are a married couple age 52/50. The hotel is very easy to find as it is right next to two Metro stops and is only a twenty five minute walk along the banks of the Seine to Notre Dame.The welcome was really friendly when we arrived, as the guy was english although the rest of the staff were french, but all spoke great english.Our room was a corner room on the fith floor overlooking the front of the hotel, it was not the largest bedroom we have stayed in but was big enough for us, nice bed and shower/bath room area. As previous reviewers have mentioned the lift will hold two people with luggage only, but after leaving the suitcase in our room it did not bother us, we mostly used the winding stairs. Our only small gripe was that the cleaners forgot to leave us any bath towels on two of our four day stay, but a quick call to reception soon rectified it. We would stay there again and recommend it to anyone who is thinking of staying in Paris. Location and things to do: If you turn left at the door and climb the street it comes to an area where there are several lovely restaurants and bars..Most serve set menus from around 11euros for a three course meal for one.Drinks are expensive, especially lager,two pints of lager cost us 18 Euros, in a back street bar, buy wine as it is much more reasonably priced. If you turn right at the door gone down street untiul you reach park called Jardin Des Plantes, a great walk down thro the park to the River Seine. We used the Batobus, this is a waterbus service which stops along the seine at various tourist spots, you can buy a day/two day/or week pass. We visited on foot most of the main tourist areas, Eiffel Tower is fantastic at night all lit up, at at the hour it flashes neon light for five minutes.Fantastic. The french seem to eat in the parks alongside Champs Elysees towrds the Louvre when its nice..... Buy a pack of Metro tickets from any station as its cheaper than buying them singularly. Sacre Coeur is worth visiting,but the the street hawkers are a real menace here.. So that it..we took the Train straight from CDG airport and it drops you off in 4 central stations in Paris, we alighted at Notre Dame and walked to hotel in about twenty minutes. Great Place,but its not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value”
Reviews.Author: GolfGrrl603
Reviews.Content: This was our first overseas visit. It was also the first time we have ever stayed at a hotel that didn't trigger our fragrance allergy. Normally, we break out in hives by day #2. We assume the sheets & towels were laundered in fragrance-free detergent. We wish more hotels would do the same. The location was very convenient. The Place Monge metro stop was just around the corner, and it's an easy, 5 minute walk to Rue Muffetard & Place de la Contrescarpe. Our room was clean & completely smoke-free, and the bed was very comfortable. Wifi was also included, and it was reliable & easy to connect to. The staff were patient, friendly & helpful. Continental breakfast was included with our room. Each morning we were served a basket of croissants & french bread, orange juice and coffee or delicious hot cocoa with steamed milk. Cereal & yogurt were also offered. The hotel was running a special, stay 3 nights and get the 4th night free. Our total tab in US dollars for the 4 night-stay was $629. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel experience, especially at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jill_2k6
Reviews.Content: My three girlfriends and myself stayed at the Hotel St. Christophe in the February half-term and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. They advised us were to find lovely restaurants and we were not disappointed. The hotel rooms were very clean and comfortable and the breakfast was continental and although not a great choice was enough to set you up for the morning. The location was excellent and only ten minutes walk to Notre Dame were we boarded the Red tour bus which I pre-booked through discount website and paid £20.00 each for the two days. I also pre-booked the Eiffel Tower and although we did have to wait it was not as long as the people who had not pre-booked. We visited the Musee d'Orsay and did have to wait about an hour to get in so I would advise if you know you are going to visit the museum pre-book! Being only four women we felt very safe around the hotel area and the restaurants we visited were about five minutes walk. The only negative that I could find with the hotel was that they did not have a safe in the room but they did have a system in place to look after any passports or valuables. I would highly recommend the hotel and if I visit Paris again would have no hessitation in booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for good location”
Reviews.Author: Eliot22
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location but that is not taking anything away from the staff, who are helpful and professional. The downside on this occasion was that the lift was out of order but I was offered another room on the second floor, instead of the sixth floor. The location, as mentioned, is great. It's a stone's throw from the metro, near a lot of great bars and restaurants and Jardin Luxembourg is around the corner. On Sundays there's even a little market where you can stock up on Camembert and French sticks for the journey back home (if you don't mind stinking out the plane/train). The rooms overall are what can be expected from a Parisian hotel in this category; a little too wobbly and wonky for comfort but perfectly agreeable for a couple of nights only.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to brag about”
Reviews.Author: howic304
Reviews.Content: The hotel was tucked away on a side street so it was very quiet. It is also located to numerous subway stops. The hotel itself is very small. The elevator was tiny, but it was able to accomodate both of us and our luggage. The room was average size for European standards. The staff was friendly and they spoke English. They willingly gave us directions to attractions and helped us book a shuttle back to CDG. If we make it back to Paris, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in an amazing city!!”
Reviews.Author: Nigro
Reviews.Content: I dont usually take the time to write reviews, but my recent parisienne experience was so amazing, I felt compelled to do so!! Firstly the location in the latin quarter is simply breathtaking. Being surrounded by les jardins des plantes is something to behold. Great hotel staff and cosy, clean rooms mean if I ever return to paris, hotel saint christophe is my first choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, good location, nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: Laura F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2010 for one night. The location was good, and the price was right at less than $120. We had a small, but clean room that opened onto an inner court yard. The staff was pleasant, and the lobby is fairly nice. Our bathroom was clean and well-lit, but had a slightly funky sewer smell (then again, don't most Parisian bathrooms?). For the price, I'd say this was a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central location”
Reviews.Author: airmilesjen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. Winthin walking distance to most major sites but still has a neighborhood feel. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the breakfast is a perfect start to the day. The rooms are small the bathrooms are bigger than average. This is my favorite place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel in a great Parisian neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Richard W
Reviews.Content: We stayed eight nights in the St. Christophe. It is located in a lively neighborhood of students, tourists, families, shops and cafes. A short walk takes you to the Place Contrascarpe and Rue Moufetard with their many cafes. It's an easy walk to the Luxembourg gardens and even to the Seine and the Ille de Cite. Our room was small but cozy with a surprisingly large bathroom with full tub and stand up shower. Our room had large french windows that overlooked the street. The elevator is small but was in good order. The staff was professional and helpful. Metro stops are very close.

Reviews.Title: “Ohlsson family Sweden, Norway”
Reviews.Author: Birgitta S
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights with our grown-up sons and their girlfriends. We were extremely satisfied epecially with the reception staff. One of us lost his backpack on the train from the airport and they did everything they could to help us get it back - and succeeded! We chose the RER train when we left and the staff checked so no linework was going on that could cause delays. The location is perfect with good and cosy restaurants around the corner for both breakfast and dinner. Most things within walking distance which we appreciated a lot. Very clean rooms - small but well organised with everything we could need. We did not have breakfast at the hotel since there are so many nice and interesting places to choose from in the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well-priced and well-located”
Reviews.Author: Brennan_Family_NY
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel for my friend and me for our 5-day visit to Paris. We could walk to all of the centrally-located sites and there was a Metro stop and very nice outdoor market 1 block away. A number of the guests took the breakfast but we preferred the many cafes and boulangeries nearby (all less expensive). I had a TERRIBLE experience with the airport shuttle service. They picked me up on time but proceeded to spend over an hour driving all over Paris picking up other customers. If I hadn't had priority access on my airline, I would have missed my flight. But the hotel itself was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but do not use the airport transfer service recommended by the hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenao
Reviews.Content: This was going to be a four star review, we loved the hotel, the room was comfortable and clean & the bathroom was good with an excellent shower. There was noise from I think the metro but nothing tragic. The location was good & there were plently of places to eat & drink within a few minutes walk. The downside was that at check in we were encouraged to book a shuttle to the airport & a pick up time was suggested (& accepted) we paid a deposit. We arrived back at the hotel ahead of the agreed time. After waiting for around 30 minutes after the shuttle was due the man on reception phoned the shuttle operators & we were informed that there has been a mistake & there would be a further delay before the shuttle would arrive but the timing could not be guaranteed. On this basis we cancelled the shuttle & used the RER / Metro to get to the airport & we made it with a few minutes to spare. This was poor and the stress this problem caused detracted from what was an enjoyable weekend. To repeat a great hotel, but avoid offers of shuttle airport transfers - I was told this was unsual - but one problem of this nature is one too many...we could have missed our flight!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock983
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Saint Christophe in April 2011 for five nights. We arrived early and our room was not yet ready. The reception staff offered to have the room ready within an hour if we needed to rest before beginning our touring. Our double room was well sized for Paris, clean, and extremely quiet. We were able to walk to all the tourists sights, except Montmarte and the Eiffel Tower. It's close to Rue Mouffetarde, which is packed with restaurants, cafes, and shops. Several metro stations are close; the neighborhood is safe at night. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast is a bit boring but included in the room price and adequate (great coffee). I would recommend this hotel for those who want a well-located, comfortable, budget-friendly hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, very clean, breakfast included, metro stations and city bike hire both within 100 metres, would recom”
Reviews.Author: robertmcc35
Reviews.Content: Good location, good value, very clean, breakfast included, metro stations and city bike hire both within 100 metres, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit and will return !”
Reviews.Author: Vada
Reviews.Content: Previously we thoroughly enjoyed our 7 night stay at HSC in November 2009 and had no hesitation in re-booking this year, especially finding the “book 5 nights and receive 2 free nights” on hotel website. The TA reviews are consistently very good and importantly the apparent response and monitoring of reviews by hotel management, demonstrates good business practice! Staff at reception could not have been more helpful with excellent command of English and patience with someone practicing their schoolboy French. The rooms didn’t seem to be quiet as big as last visit – that is I guess - due to the passage of time and memory lapses. Room still very comfortable and warm with street views Hotel within easy walking distance from most attractions and has two Metro stations, Monge and Cardinal Limone nearby. The Seine is 10 minutes walk away and provides easy access to the Bateaubus as an alternative to the Metro. Breakfast is very basic yoghurt, croissants, and baguette - cream cheese, jam tea or coffee, still adequate to start a day in fabulous Paris. On our last stay we had a minor issue with Wi FI access, which was not free and extremely difficult to use. The hotel now has free Wi Fi with good connectivity and reasonable signal in the rooms. Also there is a full size PC with printer in reception area – very handy for printing e-tickets etc. Unfortunately for us we had to cut our 7 night stay short by 4 days to return to Australia for a family emergency. We were notified by phone in the very early hours of the morning. We then sought the assistance of the guy (can’t remember your name I’m sorry) who was on night reception duties to print off revised airline e-tickets, settle accounts, cancel a previously arranged shuttle and call a taxi. All of which he did in a very professional and helpful manner – thank you! When we return to beautiful Paris – we will return to HSC – Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BrettKD
Reviews.Content: A lot of things have already been said, but I thought this was a great hotel for our first trip to Paris, although I don't have anything to compare it to. The staff was friendly and very nice. I was prepared to be staying in a closet, but I thought the rooms were a good size, I've stayed in smaller rooms in the US. The rooms were also very clean, and clean every day we stayed. The bathroom was small, but probably normal for Paris. Having the mini fridge was very handy. The location was great, being close to the Place Monge metro station. The area is also not very touristy which we enjoyed despite being tourists. We had to give our key to the staff when we left, but we never saw the front office unattended so we felt the keys were safe. The elevator was the smallest one I've ever seen, I'm a fairly big guy and we piled in with one of the cleaning ladies which was a good laugh. I would definitely stay here if we went back.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian charm!”
Reviews.Author: Jesslovesyummyfood
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in Paris, so I have nothing to compare it to, but I was really happy with Hotel Sainte Christophe, which I picked based on tripadvisor reviews. Our room on the fifth floor was a touch bigger than I expected, after reading so many warnings of tiny hotel rooms in Paris. The bathroom was a really decent size and all was clean with traditional decor and furniture. We stayed in August and it was quite warm but a large fan was provided which helped. The staff on reception were very friendly and polite and not only put up with but let me practice my schoolgirl French. Breakfast was not included in our room rate so we ate a croissant at the cafe round the corner (un bistrot en ville, I think!) where we also had really delicious coffee served by a funny waiter. The hotel is in a good location in a quiet street in the Latin quarter. There are many cafes, bars and restaurants a few minutes away and Place Monge metro is a minute's walk around the corner. We had a fantastic time in Paris and wouldn't hesitate to pick Sainte Christophe again!

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in September 2011 with a friend, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location in the Latin Quarter, near to the Mosque, the Jardin de Plantes, and two wonderful markets. Our room was quiet, facing on to Rue de La Clef, and quite roomy. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times, and I would definitely return - if I'm ever fortunate enough to get to Paris again ...

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JulieRMichigan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Saint Christophe for 6 nights with my 22 year old daughter in mid-October. It was exactly as described by earlier comments so there were no real surprises. A few comments mentioned that the rooms were larger than other "boutique" hotels in Paris. Those rooms must be really tiny, because our room was pretty small. But for the price and location, it was perfect. And the bathroom made up for the smallish room. It was small but had a real tub-shower with a shower curtain that actually kept the rest of the room dry, the walls and floor were marble and all of the corners were nice and clean and mildew-free. We paid 150 euros a night (including breakfast) and similarly priced hotels that had availability were not as nice or had poor locations. It was awesome to be only a block or so from the metro when we were returning after a long day walking around seeing the sights. (We could hear the metro at night but it was more of a low rumble.) The restaurants on Rue Moufftard are only a few blocks away as are most of places Ernest Hemingway hung out at when he was first in Paris. The front desk staff was very friendly as were the women who served breakfast and took care of the rooms. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling on a budget. One caution: if you have mobility issues, this might not be the hotel for you unless there are rooms available on the ground floor. The elevator is tiny and was not working a couple times while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, convient, comfortable and affordable Near Place Monge”
Reviews.Author: BentleyOaks
Reviews.Content: I have lodged at this property four or five times over the last ten years, most recently in February 2011. The hotel has been consistently clean, quiet, and comfortable. Rooms are a bit small buty adequate, as are many in Paris. The location is excellent. Just off Rue Monge and only a few blocks from Rue Moffetard, there are many choices for reasonably priced dining. Two groceries, pharmacists, hair salon, veternarian, banks with machines, and an internet cafe (if you don't travel with notebooks) are in immediate vacinity. Bus and Metro are only a few steps from hotel on rue Monge. This hotel is particularly good for individuals traveling solo or sharing a room with friend or spouse. Due to room size, it might not be ideal for larger families. Staff in reception area are knowledgeable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - noisy metro”
Reviews.Author: Goldeneagle_12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently for 3 nights and for a boutique hotel in Paris it is defintely one of the nicer ones I have stayed in. The hotel is in a good location (for good restaurants nearby head towards Rue Mouffetard) and the hotel is very clean with lovely furniture and tastefully decorated. While the room is small having stayed in several boutique hotels in Paris I can assure you that this is the case everywhere and I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the bathroom. The big downside for me however was the noise of the metro. I could feel the vibrations of the metro from my room and this definitley affected my ability to sleep (it runs from around 5am until well after midnight so only a 4 hour window in between!). I was on the third floor so it's not like I was close to the basement. As I mentioned previously I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Paris but have never experienced this before and for this reason I won't be returning to this hotel which is such a pity as I thought it was excellent in every other aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Very Parisienne”
Reviews.Author: paul a
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 10 days during Sept/11. We found the hotel to be very clean and quiet. The view was great with flowers in the window boxes on iron balconies which was very Parisienne. The room was a decent size and the bed was comfortable. We had a TV which did offer a couple of English stations and a radio in the room as well. The bathroom was clean with a full tub and shower and it had a window as well. We took the breakfast option which included coffee, juice, croissants and cheese and jellies which was very good. The hotel was in a good area, close to shops, pharmacies, cafes, restaurants, parksand the metro and bus routes.There was even a market which operated 2 days of the week. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “2 days in Paris”
Reviews.Author: guycan2
Reviews.Content: With only 2 days in Paris, this hotel proved to be well positioned to the major sights, Metro, restaurants, shops etc. The rooms were clean & updated & of a good size by european standards. The staff were very friendly & helpful. The only downside was the fact that the elevator was not working on the first day. We did take advantage of their breakfast as it was pricey compared to others nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: derekp308
Reviews.Content: If you want a decent inexpensive hotel in Paris, this is a nice choice. I stayed here recently for several night in Paris and had a pleasant stay. Very clean and pleasant rooms, with a full bath, and comfortable beds, plus the TV had at least a couple of English channels, including BBC World. Excellent staff, the man at the reception desk told me of some square about a couple blocks away that had all kinds of restaurants. Went down there, and was not disapointed, for I found a Persian restaurant and a pizzeria that were both really good. Plus its in a great location, right on the edge of the Latin Quarter, with the Pantheon and the Paradis Latin only a few minutes walk away. Not very far from the Metro too, plus I found a laundromat only a two minute walk away, not something you find in Europe very much. All in all, great value (I paid about 130 euros per night) for Paris, and it helps that its in a safe looking area, even at night.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere between average and very good!”
Reviews.Author: sheilaotr1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned after spending 10 nights at this hotel! The location is great, located just on the tip of the Latin Quarter. The bed was tiny, and I did have a sore back most of the trip from the mattress, which was quite worn. Our room was nice however, very clean and lots of hot water! The location was somewhat noisy, some kind of construction going on now outside the windows but that is not anyone's fault.The coffee was not very good, but across the street they make a great Coffee and the bakery is delicious! My main complaint is regarding an argument about the phone. They stated that there were no charges for using the phone with our AT&T card, yet upon check out they charged us over 80 Euro's! We are seasoned travellers and this has never happened. They refuse to take off the charges so that is a bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Audrey”
Reviews.Author: Audrey578
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights at the end of August and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.The rooms were clean and comfortable and the English speaking reception staff were always helpful and pleasant.With its excellent location, free internet, and the Metro close by we will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Shutterbug0308
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, convenient to Rue Monge metro and walking distance to the Pantehon, Luxembourg Gardens, Rue Moufettard, Staff is very welcoming and friendly and speaks very good English. Rooms are a good size and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Robyn F
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at St Christophe and it is literally 100 metres from the Metro. It is also well located in a very safe area of Paris and there are many inexpensive eateries and bars just a stones throw away from the Hotel. The reception staff were helpful and spoke fluent English which was important for us as we spoke minimal French! The rooms were smallish but i suspect this is standard for Paris. They still had everything that was needed and you can open up the windows into your room so you can look out into the street. We would highly recommend this place due to its perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in September”
Reviews.Author: caia
Reviews.Content: we stayed in room 31 and it was more than adequate in fact it was much larger than expected. I suspect however that the room could be unbearable in the summer as there is no airconditioner. the hotel is in a great location with the metro less than 100' away all of the staff were helpful except for the night clerk who was a complete jerk. he was always to busy to answer questions and screwed up our taxi to the airport. not only did the taxi not show up on time, it wasn't a taxi when it did show up. it and ended up costing 65 euro which is more than a regular taxi. worst yet, when we ordered the taxi for 4:45 am so that we would get to CDG by 5:30 am (2 hours before our flight) he didn't tell us that the airport did not open until 6:00 am. we could have slept for 1/2 hour more

Reviews.Title: “Très joli hôtel dans la 5'ième”
Reviews.Author: ReneGoudriaan
Reviews.Content: Our stay, two twin rooms, was unforgettable. The beds are good, the reception staff was nice, helpful and spoke fluent english. The radio and television and WiFi worked perfectly well. We know where to go when we go back to Paris in Spring 2012.

Reviews.Title: “A total gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustny
Reviews.Content: You can not beat this hotel in terms of price and location. The rooms are clean, the bathroom is large by Paris standards, and the staff is friendly. The only downside is the tiny elevator, but that too is pretty standard in Paris. I ended up taking the stairs except for when carrying my luggage. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NikolaRasic
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Saint Christophe for a week. It was overall a very pleasant location. The location is perfect: very nice neighborhood and the hotel is right on top of a subway station. The rooms were very nice and clean, the bathrooms were exceptionally clean and well equipped. WiFi internet was available at no charge. Breakfast was OK according to French standards but the staff serving it was a bit sloppy sometimes. The price was great for Paris. I would certainly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “For an overpriced city, this budget hotel offered a fair price and friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Leogirl11300
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel in a good area. The rooms are super tiny and the Internet rarely worked. The bathroom was comfortable other than the shower curtain being too short so water would soak the bathroom floor. Which meant we had to waste our clean towels to sop up the water daily.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back, for sure !!!”
Reviews.Author: Waldemar G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August for 8 days. The rooms was very pleasant, clean and tidy. The staff were incredibly friendly, nice and helpful. Breakfast was plentiful-cold cereal, great coffee, yogurt and a wonderful basket of croissants, breads and pastries. The staff allowed us to store our bags there before and after our stay and, best of all, were really friendly and gave excellent information. In addition, we loved the location of the hotel-within walking distance to the main sights of Paris and two blocks from the Rue Mouffetard, full of charming bistros. It's possible to walk to Notre Dame, Pantheon, Jardin de Plantes, Jardin du Luxembourg ...

Reviews.Title: “First class. Loved it. Will be back.”
Reviews.Author: sweetsfortreats
Reviews.Content: What friendly people. I met the reception staff and the breakfast staff and couldn't have asked for more helpful people. The room was spotlessly clean and the shower was the best. There were no down-sides. only plus-sides. I will most certainly be booking in again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, uncomplainable prices, good breakfast, friendly staff, nice room :-)”
Reviews.Author: Anne F
Reviews.Content: The staff was welcoming, helpful and friendly. Breakfast was nice with croissants, white bread, orange juice and serials. Loved the coffee and the breakfast-room was nice. Room was clean, nice and the style warm and french. Location great with metro nearby. Safe place to stay with a quiet street outside, not far from the senter of the exiting latin-quarter. I cannot think of any problems we had on this great hotel. Highly recommended. The price was uncomplainable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good area”
Reviews.Author: bill y
Reviews.Content: It took a Paris cab driver nearly 30 minutes to find this hotel after leaving the metro at St Michel. Can't understand why because I pointed her in the right direction and it was my first trip to Paris. It is a delightful hotel, small rooms but adequate. Lovely breakfast served in the basement and helpful on reception. About 15 min walk slightly downhill to Notre Dame but if you need the metro there is one just a few blocks away. A very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Happy at Hotel Saint Christophe!”
Reviews.Author: Travelmoma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July with our two children and got two rooms. The rooms were small but very pleasant, clean and tidy. One opened to the street and the other to the courtyard and both were lovely. However, the one toward the street was lighter and had more ambiance. The staff were incredibly friendly, nice and helpful. Breakfast was plentiful-cold cereal, great coffee, yogurt and a wonderful basket of croissants, breads and pastries. The staff allowed us to store our bags there before and after our stay and, best of all, were really friendly and gave excellent information. In addition, we loved the location of the hotel-within walking distance to many attractions and some great restaurannts as well as the train station that we came into. Four thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: chefeileen
Reviews.Content: I know Paris hotels well and this one is an excellent choice if you are looking for a step up from a budget hotel but still want something reasonable. The rooms are very comfortable, clean and the bath is exceptionally nice. The mini-fridge comes in handy when you want to buy cheese! The staff is very helpful. Breakfast is as one would expect -- juice, bread, croissants, cereal and yogurt. The location is ideal. The bus stop is around the corner and the metro stop is a block or two away. You can easily walk to Nortre Dame and stroll through the Latin Quarter. Yet, you are in a neighborhood and you can get a glimpse into Paris life. The cheese store is typical and fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very friendly”
Reviews.Author: tlc69
Reviews.Content: We liked the location which is near the botanical gardens. The hotel is slightly out of the tourist mainstream but was only a 15 minute walk to Notre Dame. We stayed in two different rooms and both were small. The breakfast is standard and not worth the $12 price since there are pastry shops nearby and a morning food market at the Place Monge. The staff of this hotel are very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.....friendly service and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: John_W_063
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at hotel and recommend Hotel Saint Christophe to those traveling to Paris who are looking for a reasonable price in a great location. While room for a single person was relatively small, it was comfortable and clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Plus hotel stay included a great breakfast each morning...juice, coffee, cereal, yogurt, great croissant and other breads. The hotel, which is 6 floors, does have a lift. Best of all is the location....right in the latin quarter and a block from a metro station (Place Monge). I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms but clean safe and quiet”
Reviews.Author: diverguy
Reviews.Content: nice neighborhood, easily walkable to downtown tourist attractions and good restaurants in the neighborhood, tiny rooms with big windows and good light, decent sized bathroom, helpful staff, everywhere else we stayed in France (outside paris) was nicer, but I think this is a good deal for paris

Reviews.Title: “Only one real issue...”
Reviews.Author: BryanR-W
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the 'good bits': Really good location - if you've never considered staying in the 5th Arrondissement before, you really should; it's a charming area and this hotel is ideally placed to visit the Jardin des Plantes and to walk to Île de la Cité and La Sorbonne (there is an excellent 'English Pub' called The Bombardier at Place du Panthéon that sells pints!). The Metro station (Monge) is only a short walk to the hotel and Rue Monge itself has a good few eateries and a very welcomed supermarket for all those essentials. The hotel itself is clean (though we did find a large dust ball on the bathroom floor). Bathroom had a decent hairdryer, plenty (and I mean plenty) of hot water - the shower was superb! The room itself was typically small but well equipped with a fan, large double wardrobe with full length mirrors on the doors and shelving and hanging space for your clothes. The windows were large and opened right up to allow in some much needed breeze 9it get hot in Summer) and the best thing was that although Rue Monge (and the cafe just in front of the hotel) can get noisy, the windows more than adequately dealt with this. The bed was very comfortable with lovely large pillows (and extra ones in the wardrobe if needed). There was a minibar with plenty of room for you to store a couple of bottles of your own wine if so desired (and it worked well, so the wine was really beautifully chilled!). The staff were very friendly and personable and spoke English very well. There is a small lift (meant to carry four, but felt very 'snug' with only two!) and a library of books in English, French and German for you to lend (I left our 2011 edition of DK's Paris guide book and map, so if you borrow it, hope it's useful!). We didn't eat breakfast there, but currently it is 9€ per person (I booked via Expedia and although they advised that we would have to pay a local room tax in actual fact, we didn't; but breakfast was NOT included in the price we paid so be aware of that and check your own booking if you get a package deal). There is Wifi and access to a PC terminal (with printer) in the reception, but this is charged at 4.50€ per stay - not too bad really (WiFi was 'free' but you need an access code which they will happily supply to you if you ask in reception). Only two 'moans' really: one was the TV. It works well and can't be turned up to loudly to annoy you or your neighbours, but the only channels in English were a couple of news channels (and not good ones at that!). Now, I know we were in France, but I really do feel that it should not be too difficult to cater to English, German and Spanish etc. guests with one or two 'entertainment' channels. We were lucky, we had a WiFi smartphone so we could watch UK TV clips on Youtube! The biggest gripe has to be the situation with the room key: you must leave this in reception whenever you leave the hotel. Problem is that the key is stored in a pigeon hole system that is in the reception, but is not BEHIND reception (it is in fact, quite an ‘open’ reception area) and so your key is NOT secure. One evening, we returned to the room to find that the key would not work. Reason? We had mistakenly taken the key to the room next door! And quite clearly, they were not in the hotel as they had left their key (you only get one). If we were NOT honest people, we could have easily gone into their room and... well, it's obvious really! Similarly, 'anyone' could have taken our key and gone into our room too – I would hope that anyone who just came in ‘off the street’ would be challenged; however we came in late one night and the Night Porter having never seen us before, happily allowed us to take the room key with no enquiry; I didn't even have to give him our name). We felt that we had no option but to take all our valuables, passports etc. out with us every time we left the hotel because although there is a safe for use by guests, they clearly states that they are not responsible for any goods left in it. To us, this aspect was really worrying and was a real mar on the whole stay - be aware!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Brisbanetraveller91
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel I stayed in on my one month trip of Europe and I was pleasantly surprised. While the room was small, it was not an issue for me as I was travelling solo. The room had a bar fridge, and the shower worked well. The room was very clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful in providing information on public transport options and spoke English quite well which was helpful as my French was limited. Breakfast was a little overpriced at 9 euro a day but you got a couple of pastries, yogurt, cereal and a choice of juice or tea or coffee. The location was quiet at night and a supermarket, pharmacy and the local metro station were very close by. Most of the attractions were in walking distance with the Pantheon very nearby. Would definitely recommend this other travellers - it was a great place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely charming hotel & staff!”
Reviews.Author: CBella
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay at the Saint Christophe, and would heartily recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel in Paris. The area is great, not too busy or too touristy (except for Rue Mouffetard a couple of blocks away) with lots of restaurants, shops, bakeries etc. nearby, and very close to 2 metro stations. Though Place Monge station does have a lot of stairs - we managed with our 2 large suitcases, baby and pram, but was a bit of a workout, so best be prepared for this! We were pleasantly surprised with the size of our room on the third fllow - even with a cot for our 6 month old baby, we still had ample room. Free wifi was great, as was the generous breakfast in the morning, with lovely pastries and lots of coffee! The ladies who served breakfast were very friendly, and were very kind to our baby. Reception staff were also very helpful, and always had a smile for us. They spoke English perfectly as mentioned by other reviewers. A few other touches were appreciated - extra rubbish bags were provided in our room for the baby, as well as extra towels and amenities. THe hotel was definitely one of our favourites during the holiday - we felt very at home, and welcomed. Hoping to travel back one day!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and the location.”
Reviews.Author: GESLMS
Reviews.Content: We had traveled in june. We had booked 2 rooms double and twin., (1 couple, 1 teenage daughter and grandmother). . The rooms was sufficent in size, the bed and pillows were very comfortable. A portable fan was provided. Our window remained closed during the night related to the street noise. The room did not have air conditioner. I would not feel comfortable if we had booked it in aug when it would be hot. the bathroom had a tub/shower. The staff was very accommadating and nice.They did speak english very well. They had recommeded resturants in the area, arranged our transportation to the airport. The area is clean and safe. I would recommend it for famiiles. The hotel does have a lift. The hotel was close to the Metro, Plenty of resturants within walking distance to choose from! Breakfast : cold cereal, yoguart, tea/coffee/ orange juice/ plenty of the croissants/breads! We would recommend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Brear place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: tlwalles
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and my daughter stayed in this hotel from may 22 to may 27. The hotel has an excellent location in the Latin quarter, close to the metro, restaurants and places to visit. The staff were very nice to us, always willing to help and accommodate our requests. The room was very small, but it was enough to fit us and the crib that we requested for our 11 month old daughter. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We did love it, we went back.”
Reviews.Author: CDUTTS
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this hotel is its location. It is so easy to use the Paris Metro and we walked, metroed everywhere from here. The rooms are small, but most rooms in Europe are. The desk was very helpful and free Wi-FI made it easy to stay in touch with home. Breakfast is only average but enough to get you started for the day. It was our second time there and the local eateries were great.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaKV
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel provides a pristine and comforable room in an excellent location. My husband and I spent a week in Paris and the staff at Saint Christophe was especially welcoming and congenial. We thouroughly enjoyed this hotel that was within walking distance to all the sights we wanted to visit. We will always plan to stay here when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our 4 nights at Saint Christophe”
Reviews.Author: beachbummj
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at Saint Christophe very comfortable.We arrived earlier so our room was not ready, we stored our luggage and went sightseeing arround .The location is great..Our room was on the 4th floor room 41,the little elevator is cozy,good view of Rue Monge our room was nice and clean.Enjoyed the breakfast room miss my baguette with jam and their coffee is very good.For places to eat lots nearby....Place contrescarpe,Rue Mouffetard and Ile Saint louis....metro stop at place Monge is just around the corner just have to remember lots of stairs at that metro station but it was okay with us....would definitely stay their again....the staff is very helpful...thanks for making our stay enjoyable....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: olitasha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and had a thoroughly enjoyable stay. We drove to Paris and were able to park at an underground car park 5 mins walk from hotel, however with the exception of our trip to Versailles we left the car in the car park and walked to the various sights. The hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff were helpful and friendly. The bedroom and bathroom was cleaned to a high standard every day. We stayed with my daughter and her boyfriend and they liked the fact that there was no charge for the internet use, on the computer in the reception area. We cannot comment on breakfast as we always ate outt in one of the many nearby cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: limeyca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Christophe for 3 nights. It is located in the Latin Quarter close to the metro station and within walking distance of the Batobus.Great staff and a great breakfast room. Felt very at home here. The only drawback we found was the proximity to parking, which I think is a problem with many Paris Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and professional staff, clean and safe; good value”
Reviews.Author: AWA2019
Reviews.Content: my title says it all. I was especially impressed by how clean the staff keeps the rooms including bathrooms and the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “unexpected French "hospitality"”
Reviews.Author: Tinker2000
Reviews.Content: Arrived exhausted (my problem); sink not working, cleaned up in tub, informed reception (they already knew), trekked off for hours to try to get my phone fixed, came back, napped and woke at 8:00pm. Sink not working!! Went to reception "What do you expect us to do at this time of night?" they said very stroppily. No, we don't have any other rooms. This was the classic Parisian 'not my problem' rudeness that people complain about, but in all my trips to Paris I had never seen before. Incroyable, or whatever. Not even, Madame, I am so sorry. Could you wash in the tub, je suis désolé but there is nothing to be done. When I returned after dinner they did have another room. I suppose I have just got used to better customer service over the years and was utterly shocked at the brush off I got for a real issue. I am the sort who recently put up a very run down hotel in the port in La Cieba, moribund rentals here and there, tiny rooms, bumpy beds...I am not particularly fussy, but if you don't want to make the traveller welcome you should not be in the hotel trade.

Reviews.Title: “Why We Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kat1955
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Paris and, like the rest of you reading these reviews, we struggled trying to find the best hotel. Stop reading; you've found the right hotel. Perfect location, Metro stops within 1 to 3 blocks; for Paris the room was a comfortable size, very clean!, good bathroom w/great water pressure; quite rooms w/the windows closed; an elevator (2 people & luggage), free wi-fi; wonderful staff (helpful & courteous), & Jardin des Plantes to the right, & The Pantheon a good walk uphill to the left. The main street is Rue Monge. It's full of cafes, shops, supermarkets, pharmacies, etc. For us, this was the perfect hotel & we'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the heart of Paris. Would definitely come back next time in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Crowded_Minds
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in the heart of Paris. The location is very central, near the Plade du Monge metro station. Very handy! The neighbourhood is very quiet for a big city, so getting a good night's sleep was not a problem! Located in the center of the lating quarter you are only about a 10-15 minute walk from the Notre Dame. The rooms are small, but very cosy - definitely big enough for what you need them for: sleep & shower! The only "bad" thing that I have to say is that the beds are a little to short to my liking and my partner's height, but they were otherwise very comfortable! The breakfast is simple & filling, enough to get you started. If you're looking for a bacon-and-eggs style of breakfast you won't find it here. The hotel also offers free Wi-FI, handy if you bring your laptop for some on-site sight/resturant research! We would definitely return to this hotel! The reception staff is very friendly and they also speak English. Note: Place du Monge has an excellent market on weekends - looking forward to explore the local cheeses and breads next time we are here!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: paokara1940
Reviews.Content: Although it is listed with 4 stars, it did not give this impression. The location is great, however. Located in the 5th district, it is very close in the Latin Quarter and the area with some very nice restaurants, bars and nightlife. Also, very close to three metro stations and the Gare Austerlitz, where one can get a train to the Varsailles palace. Finally, it is located within 5 minutes of the Botanical garden, which is a hidden gem. The hotel offers breakfast, which was the typical fresh baguettes, croissants and pain de chocolat, with some very nice coffee. A great bakery across the street was a definate complement. If you want to see why French people love their bakeries, line up at the start of the day outside a bakery. The hotel decor and furniture definately needs some major renovation. The room was very small, even by Paris standards, although the bed was comfortable. Sound insulation was not that good, but being so tired at the end of the day, it did not matter much. The free Wifi was a definate plus. To us, the hotel was a nice place to sleep at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Surprised - Good place for our first trip to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Puddles126
Reviews.Content: Note: This review is actually based on our stay in October 2009. This hotel was really cute and surprised us. The rooms were much bigger then we expected for a European city hotel. We lucked out and got a corner room on the 4th floor with 2 nice big windows. Our room has a good sized, fully equipped, private bathroom. We left our key with the front desk when we went out, which I thought was odd but I guess this is customary? But the desk attendants were friendly and tried to help us although there was the language barrier. We felt very safe here and they locked the front door after a certain time so you get buzzed in by the front desk. We didn't really take advantage of the complimentary breakfast but I don't think it really offered much. We walked A LOT to get to a lot of the main tourist attractions, and we also took full advantage of the city subway system, which had a station a few blocks away. It was very easy to use and navigate! The bakery/cafe across the street was yummy and there was plenty of restaurants and shops to keep you full and busy. Message me for more info about our Paris trip!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: donor_kebab
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice, typical Parisian neighbourhood, conveniently close to the Quartier Latin and the St. Germain area, but being just slightly off the main touristic trails it allows you to absorb some of the real life of the city. The cafes and boulangeries on Rue Monge give you plenty of opportunities to eat well, sip your cafe au lait and watch Parisian life happening in front of your eyes. We stayed in a corner room, which is quite roomy by Paris standards. It was clean, light, and comfortable. The staff is very polite and helpful. The free WiFi access is a huge asset. All in all, it definitely merits its high rating on tripadvisor. On the negative side: The double bed is a bit small for two, or at least compared to what i am normally used to. The walls are thin, so we heard the baby in the next room crying from time to time, hence the lower rating for sleep quality. But I guess this is normal in a three star category in Paris. Anyways, despite these slight inconveniences, i would definitely stay there again, and would not hesitate to recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “All around excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Atlgirl96
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Paris for 1 week for a work conference and searched multiple areas for the "perfect hotel." After a friend's recommendation, I discovered the hidden gem of Hotel Saint Christophe. Located on the left bank in the Latin Quarter, the hotel is within walking distance of Notre Dame, the Siene River, Luxemburg Gardens, and other major sites. Furthermore, the metro (line 7, Place Monge stop) and bus lines are readily accessible. While being ideally located and in close proximity to many places, the hotel was still quiet and personal. Additional perks include a nice, clean updated bathroom, free wireless internet in room and computer in hotel lobby, and very friendly staff. For European standards, the double room was also a decent size. Compared to other hotels in this area, Hotel Saint Christophe is a great value. I would definitely recommend the hotel to other travelers, and I will stay there on my return visits. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL AND STAFF IN ALL OF PARIS”
Reviews.Author: ezegoin
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue. My wife and i spent 10 nights at the Hotel Saint Christophe and after researching over 100 hotels we decided on this one. Wow did we ever luck out. Located in the Latin Quarter this location couldnt be better. We walked to most sights, @ 10 mins to the Notre Dame and the Metro was 1 block away. The rooms were bigger than i expected, and very clean and quiet. While we were there i just had to stop and check a few of the other hotels on my list, they were'nt even close to being as nice as the Hotel Saint Christophe. Our room included breakfast and it was a great way to start the day. As nice as the rooms and location were, the staff was excellent, always very pleasant and helpful and made out stay better than i ever inagined. when we come back to Paris we will definately stay here again and save myself hours of researching. I have already recommended this hotel to frinds of mine that are planning Paris this year. To the staff there if u remember us, we got you a fresh baguette daily. Thank you very much for a great stay in Paris. Hope to see you again.

Reviews.Title: “real value added place!”
Reviews.Author: sdevaux
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located, just few steps from Place Monge. People are very nice and can help you for any information. Rooms are clean and nice according to Paris standards. Prices are more than ok for this hotel. Beds are ok, even if not fantastic. Definitely a good place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: OZTravelers10
Reviews.Content: My partner and I loved this hotel and its location. Very clean, friendly staff, big rooms for Paris. Close to Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for this location”
Reviews.Author: katiee_overseas
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, in a central area of Paris, and is good value. Rooms are compact, but this is Paris, so you won't be spending much time in them anyway, and they are comfortable and quiet which is the main thing. The hotel is within walking distance of lots of places, and also close to the Metro and bus routes. I would definitely stay here again if I was in the 5eme for business or for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mbdolan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Saint Christophe for 4 nights on quick break to Paris. Such a great location - within walking distance to Notre Dame and Jardin de Luxembourg. Surrounded by lovely shops and some little restaurants. Staff were so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “All around Average”
Reviews.Author: adamgun
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews on trip advisor. There certianly isn't anything wrong with the hotel, it's in a great location, it's clean, breakfast was included in the rate. Rooms are quite small by american standards, but that's to be expected so. Based on all the great reviews I just expexted a little bit of a spark that wasn't there. Everything was just adequate and average, but didn't quite live up hype

Reviews.Title: “Our first time in Paris - this hotel was perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: DoItAnyway
Reviews.Content: This was our first wedding anniversary and our first time in Paris. Everything had to be perfect! I scoured the internet for the best hotel and, never having been to Paris, I had no idea which one to pick. There are so many! I came upon Saint Christophe on Trip Advisor. I was almost swayed by the negative reviews that talk about the keys not being secure and Hotel Acte-V being better. I was ready to book Acte-V. I asked my husband for his opinion and he disagreed with me. He thought Acte-V looked like a place we could stay here in the SF Bay Area and said we should stay in a place a little more Parisian. He convinced me to book Saint Christophe instead and he was absolutely right. The staff was super nice and helpful. The room was cozy and charming. It was small with a double sized bed but we already expected that from all of the previous reviews, so it was fine with us. Because the hotel is so close to the metro, you'll faintly hear it rumble by on a regular basis. The bathroom was spotless with a nice big tub. The windows were my favorite part. We were in a corner room, so we had two sets of tall windows that actually open like doors so you can lean out and take in the sunrise or watch the bustling city street below. The hotel is less than a 3 minute walk to the Metro, its super close. Five minute walk to Jardin Les Plantes and a bunch of cafes and brasseries. It's less than a 10 minute walk to the Pantheon. I would say its a 20 minute walk to Notre Dame or the St Germaine area, and everything else is totally accessible by the Metro. The offer breakfast downstairs and its decent. A pastry/bread basket, some orange juice and some cafe au lait to get your day started. We only ate breakfast there twice because we wanted to try the food at a few other places to get some variety. The people who work the reception desk were the best part about the hotel though. On our last night, we came back to the hotel and asked the hotel clerk if it would be better to take the Metro or a taxi to get to the airport. My husband and I hadn't been watching the news on our vacation so we didn't realize that a major strike was scheduled for the next day! It was very late so, even though he tried, the taxi company was closed for the night and we would have to try again the next morning. He told us not to worry, and that he would have a taxi for us bright and early. Sure enough, when we were ready to go at 8:00am, the taxi was already waiting for us! The staff at this hotel truly made our stay welcome and pleasant and we would stay here again in a heartbeat. Thank you Hotel Saint Christophe for being so hospitable, friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: TheFlickGuy
Reviews.Content: The St Christophe is located about a 10-minute walk to the French Quarter and across the street from the Place Monge metro station. Our room was on the fourth floor with a view of the lively street below. The room was a decent size with a minibar and a double (not queen) bed, which we found to be a little cramped. The bathroom had a tub with the nicest shower we encountered on our trip. The area is loaded with excellent restaurants, food shops and nearby to a coin laundry which came in very handy! The desk staff was very helpful with helping us with our local transportation needs and restaurant recommendations. The breakfast was a typical Parisian continental with baked goods, cereal, yogurt and cafe au lait. A nice bonus was that the nearby metro was on the line that takes you straight to the Lourvre.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again at hotel saint christophe”
Reviews.Author: parisbound2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff gave great restaurant recommendations, spoke English very well, always willing to help and answer our questions. Chose the hotel after reading other posts and am glad we did. Very quiet , our room was on the top floor.room was small, but expected this, but was clean, and having a mini fridge in our room stocked with cold drinks was a nice perk too. The hotel staff even helped to make arrangements for us to get back to the airport by shuttle when we checked out. Would definitely recommend staying here, address is 17 rue lacepede, near rue monge.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Paris, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Saint-trav
Reviews.Content: My wife and i were in paris at the end of March 2010 and i can honestly say we were pleasantly surprised with Saint Christophe. Location and value for money for such a major city was exceptional. The rooms were fairly basic but were of a decent size, so i was very happy with that after i'd just stayed in one of the smallest hotel rooms i had ever seen in London. The staff were very welcoming and were always happy to help you with whatever was needed. The Metro is very close and with the transport system in Paris being so good, and easy to use you can get to all the major tourist sites in no time at all. Absolutely fell in love with the city itself, so i am certain to be heading back sometime in the near future and i have no reason to consider looking for anywhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gerstraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights with a 9 month old baby and found it perfect for our needs. Close to everything in a vibrant area of Paris, yet quiet enough to not hear a thing at night. The small size of the hotel meant that the staff were very attentive, welcoming and helpful, particularly with the mountain of questions we had regarding our daughter's needs (we took our own travel cot so we can't vouch for what the hotel offers in that respect). Great value and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Classic traditional french hotel in a brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: PMHenderson
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel and it did not disappoint - we even asked for the same room as our first stay and got it! It is a comfortable and elegant hotel in an ideal position to explore Paris. Who would need anything more? Rue Moufftard for evening meals, on 2 Metro (underground) lines and local bars for a wee drink or coffee after all your exploring. We will definitely be back.....

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, welcoming hotel. Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: LongReefHacker
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the no so good stuff. We stayed at the St Christophe for 3 nights from the World Cup final date onward. The weather was hot (30 degrees plus) and humid. We were given a room facing the street that was hot and, once Spanish celebrations started, very noisy. We asked if other rooms were available and the hotel staff, very obligingly, moved us to an interior room on the 5th floor. End of noise. Heat, however, remained an issue. (The hotel is not air conditioned). We slept with a fan running and windows open (into an interior well between buildings.) It was still a little uncomfortable. Now for the good stuff. This is an EXCELLENTLY run hotel with lovely staff in a very convenient location, close to the botanic garden, the Metro and a moderate walk (about a flat 1km) to the Latin Quarter. The staff (esp the lovely Adelaide) met our every request pleasantly and efficiently. We're sure that, in more moderate temperatures the hotel would have been very comfortable. Breakfast was a slightly above average continental. If the hotel were to improve anything, it might be to add fruit and a wider range of pastries in this area. Rooms are a good size, beds are comfortable (remember - we experienced 2 rooms) and bathrooms are clean, a reasonable size and have good hot water pressure. When we visit Paris again (hopefully), we'll happily book the St Christophe again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: 1dannymac
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I recently stayed at the Hotel St Christophe in May. This was a surprise trip that we got engaged on. The staff was wonderful, picking up a bottle of wine for us to celebrate. They also were very helpful in giving us directions to the Metro and how to best use it. The Metro is two short blocks away from the hotel, which makes it very convienient to get to many of the main tourist sites. The staff also did an excellent job of recommending restaurants for us. The Latin Quarter (the arrondisement the hotel is in) has a great number of places to eat at, as well as several nice cafes. This was my second stay at the Hotel St Christophe, and I will continue to stay there on future trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: OneSweetWorld
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Paris and wanted a hotel in the Latin Quarter. St. Christophe was perfect! It is reasonably priced, the staff is incredibly accomodating and the rooms are clean (although a bit small). The hotel is close to several Metro stops. In fact, there was a fabulous farmer's market near the Le Monge Metro stop on a recent Sunday morning. There are plenty of wonderful restaurants and bars nearby. I would definitely consider staying here again on another trip to Paris. My only complaint was that our room had one outlet, which in this day and age of charging cell phones and cameras, etc. was a bit frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: carotine
Reviews.Content: This was a really great little hotel for the money. The best thing about it is the location, right next to the Botanic Gardens which make a nice detour on the way to the Seine. 15 minutes walk to Notre Dame if you go the direct route. Interesting market and foodshops a minute away at Rue Mouffetard. The room was more than adequate for our short stay, and had quite a bit of storage and a nice big bathroom with excellent shower. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast did the job ahead of a day sightseeing. Would definitely recommend this place, and stay there again if I returned to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: JazAustralia
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from the reviews on this site for our easter break. We chose right. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The hotel was cozy and elegant. Our room was bigger than I expected from a Paris hotel. It was clean and nicely furnished. Great location. Close to the Metro and walking distance to fantastic restaurants. Free wi-fi access. Price not too bad for Paris. We plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to call home while in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SDBSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: My young adult daughter and I stayed at the Saint Christophe-Logis while on a trip to Paris. The location in the Latin Quarter was perfect, with fabulous cafes, bread, cheese, and wine shops just steps away on the Rue Monge. We were just blocks from the Seine and Notre Dame and a metro stop was also quite close. The peaceful Jardin Des Plantes is a 5-minute stroll down the street as well. Also, a good breakfast is available for an extra charge, but we came out ahead with coffee in cafes and croissants from across the street. Sparkling bathrooms were a plus.

Reviews.Title: “A good, no frills hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: HappyEater1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for two nights in March 2010. The best thing about the hotel is its location - around 300 metres from some of the best restaurants in the latin quarter without any of the disturbence one way and 250 metres from the Jardin de Plantes the other. It is also only a 5 minutes walk from Notre- Dame.The bedrooms and en-suite are very clean but not very large (watch out for the window catch when having a shower). Breakfast is quite a miserly affair but sufficient. The staff are friendly and very helpful. I particularly liked the hotel's full refund policy if you cancel with up to 3 days notice (a lot of hotels are dropping this). All in all, a very pleasant stay and I would not hesitate to go back or recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good for the money”
Reviews.Author: Canoldir
Reviews.Content: There are good and weak points concerning the St Christophe. It is very reasonable for a 3 star hotel ( we paid about £340 for 3 nights in a double room B and B .)The location is excellent, right next to the Metro Place Monge and just a short trip into Paris.The area is full of restaurants and bars. Service was excellent and friendly with english spoken. The bathroom was clean and the shower excellent.You are also able to use the computer in the Reception area for free.The rooms are small and dark however and we did not have bedside lights. It was December but the room was always warm. There is only one english channel on the TV. Breakfast was adequate for 8 eu each but the breakfast room was small although welcoming. It might be a problem if the hotel was full. There is not much choice apart from 2 types of cereals, pain, croissants, yoghurt etc. The one major thing that concerned me is that there is just one central staircase plus a lift and if there was a fire and this was inaccessible , you would be in danger. There are no other fire exits. You would have to wait at the window for the fire brigade! Presumably the authorities have cleared it for safety? In the area, the best bistro we went to is L'Estrapade up near the Pantheon. This place was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel on the left bank, great value”
Reviews.Author: jrothmd
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, great location on the left bank, next to Monge metro station. Refrigerator in room, several bakeries in the neighborhood which provide better breakfast than hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Endorsement for all previous positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: Vada
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based solely on TA reviews and importantly the apparent response and monitoring of reviews by hotel management, good business practice! Staff at reception could not have been more helpful with transport and restaurant recommendations. (Try the Rue Mouffetard restaurants, excellent 3 courses for 12-20E per person- about 300 metres from the Hotel). We arrived after surviving a minor auto crash in Belgium and I needed a doctor to remove some sutures. Gentleman at reception (sorry don't remember your name) organised an appointment with a nearby doctor without any fuss, thankyou!. Hotel within easy walking distance from most attractions and has two Metro stations, Monge and Cardinal Limone nearby. The Seine is 10 minutes walk away and provides easy access to the Bateaubus as an alternative to the Metro. Room was clean and warm with a view over nearby street. Breakfast is very, very basic youghurt, croissants, baguette - cream cheese, jam tea or coffee. We stayed for 8 nights and after two basic breakfasts (not even the usual ham - cheese or egg options/alternative), we sought out alternate opportunuties. (The little cafe directly across the street from the hotel entrance provides excellent coffee and omlette with bacon for a very competitive price. The owner/manager has a good command of English and it is very convenient and cheap beer and wine for that after walking all day relief.) A minor issue for us was the WiFI access. We had travelled for 10 weeks in western Europe staying at 26 Hotels, pensions and B&B, we relied heavily upon WiFi for e-mails and Skype as a means to keep in touch with immediate family and friends. Hotel Christophe was the first hotel to charge for WiFi access. Not only charge, but the service was provided by an outside source "Örange", which was not only expensive 10E for three hours access, but extremely user UN-friendly. You are obliged to log in on each occasion, the usernames and passwords provided are difficult to distinguish between i I and 1 etc. Making each access tiresome. On occasions, possibly due to workload the whole Orange system slowed down making writing an e-mail take twice as long and burning up the Euros. The Hotel Christophe is highly recommended for all the right reasons, however, if you need WiFi access for business or communication, you would need to consider an alternative. Perhaps management might consider an alternative WiFi provider or system as we enter 2010?

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dr_McMonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in 2006, on the recommendation of a French friend and previous tripadvisor reviews. On our experience, we would be happy to stay here again. Staff were welcoming and friendly, able to point us towards a local square containing several cafes and restaurants and a vibrant nightlife - it seemed like staying in a small village, rather than a capital city. The inhouse breakfast is plain and basic, but there are plenty of eateries to hand, and the Seine and Notre Dame are within an easy walk. The room was small but very clean and comfortable, with a shuttered bathroom window - one could recline in the bath and feel the city just outside. Romantic, and the whole setting is just right as a stepping point to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Would Use Again. Enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew G
Reviews.Content: Had spotted this hotel on previous stay in the area, and had booked it following reviews on Tripadvisor. Glad we did. Thoroughly enjoyable 7 night stay. Comfortable room and bathroom. A little bit small, but this is central Paris. We had room 11 with a street view, but noise not a problem as double glazing excellent. Staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast OK, but found slightly better option in nearby cafe. Whole area is excellent for eating and drinking. Metro about 30 seconds from hotel. Easy connection from CDG -- RER to St Michel/Notre Dame, then walk or metro. Would definitely like to use again, and have no hesitation in recomending to others.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: johnbonn25
Reviews.Content: Thank you Tripadvisor reviews. We chose this little gem because of Tripadvisor and as per usual it did not disappoint us. We had a wonderful stay at Saint Christophe. All positives were echoed in most of the reviews. A good location,at a great price for Paris that was clean, with a modern bathroom, and helpful, pleasant staff. Easy to get to from CDG. Metro practically outside the door if you want to use it. We walked everywhere...it helped to wear off the croissants and wine! Elevator tiny and we would have liked to keep our key but that was not an issue. Definitely would repeat and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Bizarro key policy”
Reviews.Author: azim31
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this hotel is in a good location (Latin Quarter) and the rooms are clean and adequate. The reason I am giving them a low rating is b/c of their bizarre and unsafe key policy. They want you to leave your room key with them everytime you step out of the hotel. And when I say leave your key with them, I do not mean behind some secure counter where only the hotel staff have access. There is an open cabinet with hooks next to (not behind) the reception desk within easy access of anybody who walks into the lobby. In fact when we first showed up there was nobody in the lobby for at least 5 minutes, plenty of time for somebody to stroll in, grab a key (b/c they know whatever key they pick, that room will be empty) and take whatever they want. For the first couple of nights we just kept the key and waked quickly out of the lobby before any staff could say anything. However on our last night in Paris as we were walking out to get some dessert the guy manning the desk (actually he was on the lobby computer which is supposed to be for guests instead of behind the reception desk) asked for our key. When we explained we didn't feel safe leaving the key he became heated and said it was hotel policy and although his english wasn't good we thought he said he would call the police on us if we didn't hand over our key. We started to fear he would lock us out if we stepped out so we had the pleasure of spending our last night in Paris trapped in our room. If you don't mind handing over security of your items to some hired help who was hogging the guest's computer (by the way they charge for wifi which is really nickel and diming guests) by all means stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Charmante -met all our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Flanne
Reviews.Content: After reviewing numerous hotels in what we knew would be an expensive city, we settled on Ste Christophe for its appearance, price and location. We made the map on their website our screen saver, boned up on the Latin Quarter, and that area was, basically, the focus of our 4 days. Our goal was to learn more about a city we already loved, and even on the last morning we were still discovering --the Roman arena, Jardin des Plantes and another patisserie. The hotel's location is accessible to Metro so that we needed only that coming in from London on Eurostar. Staff are enthusiastic and helpful, our room attractive and spotless, and while a view would be nice, the inside location meant quiet. We'll definitely go back when we're able to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, price and room”
Reviews.Author: Teach4
Reviews.Content: The location near the Metro, the neighborhood, and the price of the room were the three main considerations in choosing this hotel. IThis was my 5th trip to Paris and I wanted to stay in another part of the city this time, yet still be close enough to the central sites that an easy hike or Metro ride was all that was needed to navigate the city. I was pleasantly surprised by our twin room for the price! It was roomy, had a small yet modern bathroom, fan, TV, view of the back street from the full length windows, and a large closet. There was a mini bar for drinks as well. The elevator had just enough room for our two suitcases and us to ascend to our 3rd floor room. Breakfast was adequate- cereal, yogurt, juice, tea or coffee and bread & jelly. The daytime staff was pleasant, and there was someone at the desk later at night when we came in from our sightseeing. The only things that I can think of that could be improved are that the breakfast staff seemed too busy talking to really pay much attention to the guests, the beds were typically a bit harder than most people are used to here in North America, and the night staff wasn't as friendly as the day time staff. This is really nit picking though. I would choose this hotel again for a Paris vacation. The value for money is very good!

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Little Place Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: gnomiesprite
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a three day weekend in November. The room is small--but served it purpose. The hotel was clean and the woman at the desk was very sweet and helped us make a reservation at a french restaurant. Breakfast was usual parisian far--lots of carbs, DELICIOUS chocolate croissants and yummy hot chocolate. We loved that we could walk to Notra Dame and the area near the Pompidiue (sp?). Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jesfa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a 19 day trip to France in September 2007. We wanted somewhere reasonable and central for exploring Paris, but not a modern cookie-cutter hotel room. This hotel was clean, quiet, convenient but still had the old world charm we were looking for, right in the Latin Quarter (arrondissement 5). It's located near Jardin des Plantes, and within easy walking distance to the Panthéon and Notre Dame. It's very near two Métro stops (Place Monge and Cardinal Lemoine). I think the latter was better for suitcases as there were less stairs. Breakfast is served in the basement, nothing fancy but enough to get you going in the morning. If we ever had any questions, the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room overlooked the street, but was quiet and very comfortable. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, but great location”
Reviews.Author: enigmatic1jen
Reviews.Content: I was very trepidacious about staying at this hotel after finding out that they did NOT have air-conditioning and I was going to be staying there in mid August.
