Luckily though, I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel itself is simple and charming, nothing fancy, but very accommodating. The one thing that did concern me is that I went right up and grabbed my own key to my room when no one was standing there, which I found a litte scary, but that was my only significant complaint other then the air-conditioning. The room itself was on the small side, but that is to be expected. What made up for that fact was that I had an end room which offered two bright windows through which I could look out onto the quaint little street. The bathroom was also a pleasant surprise, I was expecting something shabby, however, it was decent sized and was done in marble. It also offered a lovely bathtub. The location itself is ideal. It was only a block over from the Place Monge Metro station, and you could easily walk to the Jardin's de Luxembourg (my favourite), to the Pantheon, to Notre Dame, and even to the Louvre if you are willing to walk a bit further. Overall it is quite a great location. I would recommend this hotel to someone as long as they do not have a problem with the lack of air-conditioning, and lackadaisical attitude about the keys.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at your aunt's house, not at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: callt
Reviews.Content: That's not necessarily a bad thing. This is why I think that staying here is like staying with your aunt. Or maybe your grandma. -You have to leave the key with the hotel staff whenever you leave the hotel. -They close the doors at 10 p.m. and you have to ring a bell to get in -There's a note in the room that says they like to clean the room between 11 a.m and 2:30 p.m and to please accommodate that time frame. - No matter what condition I left the room in for the maid, when I came back the fan was turned on and the curtains and windows were opened to let in sunlight and a breeze. - The furniture was very nice and antiquey - I was afraid the whole time that I'd spill beer or soda on the nice velvet chair. So this is all not necessarily bad, just something you should be prepared for. It's not like staying at an anonymous hotel but more like an inn or B&B. If you like this, you should be just fine. The best thing about this place is definitely the room. I enjoyed coming back to my room after a day of sightseeing. While the TV is tiny and the bed is very, very low, and it was extremely hot (please be aware that there is no air conditioning) there was something comforting and homey that made the room a pleasure to be in. Otherwise, the Metro is very close and there are good patisseries within a block or two. While I would not hesitate to stay again, I would also try a different place.

Reviews.Title: “worst 3 star in Paris no aircon more like a hostel dated decor depressing doesn't deserve the rave reviews here”
Reviews.Author: AsisFrance
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveller and was lucky enough to have 2 weekends in a row in Paris recently. The first time I stayed with a friend in the Hotel Acte V around the corner from this one. It was great 3 star, modern refurb, friendly staff, great bar and lounge area, large well furnished rooms, aircdon, flat screen tv, little balconies, quiet, great location. For the second trip which was a romantic weekend away with my husband sans enfant I choose the 'sainte christophe' *because it was 150 points higher* than the Acte V on Trip advisor. What a *terrible* mistake. We couldn't believe it when we arrived to the drab, dated, run down place with no aircon and hot still little rooms (so hot other guests on the same floor were lying on their beds in the heat with the doors open for all to see!) This place is a 1 star compared to the Acte V and just shows how the good Trip Advisor system can be distorted wrongly and good hotels (and ultimately travellers pay). I have learnt from this run a mile from a hotel that appears on 'trip advisor' where every guest comment is followed by a management one thanking them as it shows the hotel doesn't have time to clean rooms properly (our room had a pile of old towels on the floor when we got there) or refurb. I know you can do much better for the money than the Sainte Christophe. They wouldn't let us cancel our booking for the first night but we stayed at the Acte V the second for sure thankfully.

Reviews.Title: “Conviently located and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: thesaint01
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this small hotel in the Latin Quarter in Paris. The hotel is located very close to the Rue Monge metro station on Line 7 (1-2 minutes). In the vincinety of the hotel several good restaurants (if you are a fan of Vietnamese food, check out Foyer de Vietnam a few minutes from the hotel), bars and cafes are located. The hotel is however located on a side street so it is a quiet yet central location. It is possible to walk (approx 10-15 min) to several of the major sights in the city (such as the Louvre, Notre Dame etc). The room was pretty small but still had everything we needed. It was clean and the overall feeling was that it was well-run and kept. The bed was comfortable and there was free Wifi access (as well as free Internet access at a computer in the lobby). The room also had small desk, TV (mostly French channels but a few English as well), mini bar and a fan. There was however no A/C (not a problem in late June but I am not sure how hot it will be in July/August). I did not see any safe but did not really look since we carried few valuables on this trip. The bathroom was bigger than expected with a bathtub. Soap, shampoo and shoe shine (?) was provided in the bathroom. The service was mostly friendly (different people at different times) and they spoke English (not always the case in France).The main issue I had with the staff/service was that they did not seem to watch the keys to the rooms as carefully as I would have hoped. At times when we came back to the hotel the reception could be empty with the keys left unattended. The breakfast was included when I booked and it was decent (coffee/tea(chocolate, croissants, different types of bread, orange juice and cereal with yogurt) but not something I would pay that much extra for. The staff serving breakfast were however very friendly and cheerful. All things considered we had a very good stay at Saint Cristophe and would definitely consider staying here the next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Chintzy but lovely anyway!”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleTraveller_9
Reviews.Content: While I usually prefer modern hotels, this made a really lovely and rather homely change.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back home from staying at the Hotel Saint Christophe in the Latin Quarter. We chose this hotel because of its reviews on this website, and we were not disappointed. The location is fantastic - just literally a 2 minute walk from the Place Monge subway, although we preferred to walk down to the Seine, by the Notre Dame, which is just merely about a 20 minute walk on Rue Monge. The staff at the hotel were always extremely friendly, helpful and courteous, the rooms were very clean and the bed very comfortable. We never heard any noises from the room next door, above or below us. Rue Monge is a little noisy, but we kept the front window closed at night, and left the bathroom window opened instead. Rue Mouffetard is just a short walk up from Rue Lecepede, where the hotel is located, and there is a vibrant nightlife there, with tons of restaurants, cafes, bakeries, supermarket, etc. We would most definitely stay at the Hotel Saint Christophe again, and would not hesitate to recomment it to other. Merci beaucoup!!! Au revoir!

Reviews.Title: “We love the stay in St christophe very much.We will definitly to stay at the hotel again if we are come back to”
Reviews.Author: Cop80s
Reviews.Content: The hotel manager was so heplful to confirm our shuttle booking to the airport, he did not mind to use his own cell phone and spoke French to clarify the pick up time. The ladies in the breakfast area were very friendly and courteous. The hotel was very closed to a nice ,hanging out place to find a decent dinner for a very good price (3- course meal with delicious desert for about 9 to 15 euros) .Good and central location Free hotel internet in the lobby.We traveled around Europe for 4 weeks ,stayed in several hotels ,from 2 to 4 stars , St. chistophe was the only hotel offered free internet.

Reviews.Title: “A real value for money”
Reviews.Author: 25HoliDay
Reviews.Content: We read many reviews in this website before deciding on where to stay for our first trip to Paris. We wanted somewhere comfortable and centrally located without having to spend a bomb. Saint Christophe was just that. The lady at the front desk was helpful, friendly and can communicate well in English. The room we had was clean and big enough for the two of us. There were many places to eat around the hotel and the the Metro is just less than 5 mins walk away. For people who are planning to visit in summer, you might want to know that there is no air-condition or fan in the room and it can be quite noisy in the street if you open up the windows. That said, I would still go back to Saint Christophe for its value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: nmolina
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a typical European hotel with small rooms. The bathroom was clean & had a spacious shower/tub. Staff were helpful and spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel St. Christophe Paris”
Reviews.Author: Europrob
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 5 night stay at the Hotel St Christophe in Paris. The hotel is conveniently located directly off Rue Monge by the metro station. The hotel is extremely clean and well kept . My single room was perfect with a spacious bathroom. The staff were very helpful and extremely polite and courteous. The breakfast was very good. I highly recommend this hotel. I had a good time there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LE_TOOT
Reviews.Content: The reviews say that the rooms are on the small size - they are, but if you are in Paris to see Paris then this is a perfect hotel. It is near the zoo/park - worth a walk through one morning. Just down the road is a little morning market and up another small road to the right (just before the hotel) is a small square with lots of bars for an evening drink. Its close to the metro and an easy 12min stroll to Notre Dame. The desk are friendly but I score service low as breakfast is pretty basic (thick black coffee and dry bread) so don't pay - simply get something from one of the many cafe's around. A great place to stay just a short metro/walk from the main tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: calculi
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at Saint Christophe for my first trip to Paris for 7 nights. The location is super and an easy walk to many sites and cafes. It is walking distance to the highlights of the Latin Quarter but a few blocks away from the college crowd (a good thing). The hotel is 1 block to the metro (line 7) between the North and South exits of the "Place Monge" stop. The rooms on the top floor might be a tad smaller then others but they have a great balcony with room for two to enjoy the sights and sounds of metro Paris. This isn't the quietest hotel I have stayed out but it is a great value. The only reason I didn't rate the hotel a 5 is that the staff while very friendly wasn't able to offer much advice on sights or suggestions. Also, free wifi in the lobby and/or rooms would have been nice but the free use of a computer in the lobby was convenient. There is an internet cafe only a block away if you need to print anything such as boarding passes. I suggest bringing your own soap and shampoo or buying it down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant little gem of a hotel - def recommended”
Reviews.Author: FSL
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this little gem of a hotel for a recent weekend in Paris and would def have to recommend it. It is really central within the Latin Quarter and right beside the Metro, lots of restaurants and bars, and within walking distance of many of the main sites. We arrived at noon and had a great welcome at reception with lots of recommendations. The rooms are Paris size (smallish) - but very comfortable and clean. Again, throughout our stay the staff were very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Practicality and Location!”
Reviews.Author: dantescraps2007
Reviews.Content: Again, TripAdvisor steered us correctly. My husband and I were looking for a practical little hotel in a great location that wasn't going to break the bank while we visited Paris from Christmas to New Year's. If you are a looking for a cozy little place that's close to everything, this is it. The room was smaller but this is the kind of hotel you're using as a home base, so it was great. It was clean, safe, and warm during the cold spell that descended on Paris that week so who could ask for more? The staff were very helpful at all times, day or night. There is always someone on premise, which is excellent. I will say the walls are a bit on the thin side but it's nothing unmanageable. We did not partake of the breakfast here as there were so many great little bakeries and cafes near by but the menu listed many old standbys, which would be great if you're a cautious eater or have kids. The hotel is very close to the Metro (which is very safe, clean, and easy to use) so it's very handy. It's also only a 5 minute walk from Rue Mouffetard (many little restaurants and bars- I highly recommend Le Jardin d'Ivy), 5 minutes from a little daily market down the street, and 10 minutes from Notre Dame. So, if you're looking for a homey little place where you can put your feet up at the end of a long day of sight-seeing, walking, or eating (as was the case with us), this is a great little bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: sjmacdee
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel just a few blocks from Notre Dame. The rooms are small, as everyone has mentioned, but they are clean and very comfortable. The bed linens are especially nice. The front desk was wonderful, helpful, friendly and their dinner recommendations were very good. The location is really great. You are just two blocks from Place Mufftarde, which has lots of great restaurants and pubs. There are two Metro lines within two blocks and you are only a short walk to the center of the Latin Quarter, the Louvre and Luxenbourg Gardens. The train to the airport is a short walk as well. There are great and affordable restaurants all around this location. This hotel has the largest showers we have found in Europe, a real tub! Nice towels, too. This is super little hotel in Paris. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: MarVail
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week at the Saint Christophe. We had picked this hotel because we liked the location and the price. The location was as expected: Great starting point for sightseeing by foot or using the metro. Close to affordable dining. The room? Well, you get what you pay for: A tiny little room (don't bring more than one suitcase, there's not room for more) with tiny little beds and a tiny little tv that may or may not have worked. We couldn't figure out how to turn it on (we're not very smart) and we didn't want to inconvenience the front desk by asking. We had already tested the front-desk girl's patience once, when we had locked ourselves out of the room on the first day. Having to climb one flight of stairs to unlock the room for us was clearly annoying her. After that experience, we successfully avoided approaching the front desk during the rest of our stay. Breakfast was included in our rate. It was basic but OK (we quickly learned to buy and smuggle in additional breads from the bakery across the street). Coffee was excellent - and if you are careful to avoid eye-contact with the breakfast staff, they will ignore you. They'll also ignore you if you DO make eye-contact. But who cares - the coffee was good. Free internet in the lobby. The only problem with our room was the street noise. Do bring ear-plugs, especially if you stay during a weekend. So - if you want an affordable hotel in a convenient location, this is a good pick - but we did not find this hotel neither charming, friendly nor extra-ordinary in any way. It's a cheap place to stay - we'd stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: girella
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the many good TA reviews and it turned out to be a good choice! The hotel is in a part of Paris we hadn't been to before so we were able to visit the nearby quarters by foot: Rue Moffetard, La Sorbonne, Pantheon, Saint Sulplice, Saint Germain des Pres etc... enchanting and a BIT less touristy! However the hotel is very near the underground station so we easily got to other parts of Paris. The rooms are rather small ( quite normal in France, I think!) but clean and comfortable. The staff at the check in were really nice and helpful and gave us whatever information we needed. We had some problems with the heating in our room The night guardian immediadtely tried to resolve the problem and when he didn't manage to get it going he gave us his elettric stove for the night and the day after they sent someone to mend it. We really felt like being at home!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent situation”
Reviews.Author: amf-Northumberland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the St Christophe and a long weekend in Paris with our 3 children and partners to celebrate my 60th birthday. The hotel is very well situated for the metro (Monge) and for eating out on rue Mouffetard. As we were arriving on different days, I found that I could not book on any website - or I could, but would not have been certain of getting us all in - so I booked directly with the hotel. They were not willing to offer me the same deals available on websites (inclusive breakfast.. or even a free night) but the price was a not unreasonable 110euros per 'double' room. The "children's" rooms were all quite adequate; fairly small but clean and quite comfortable. Ours (24), unfortunately, was incredibly tiny and cramped with barely room to walk round the small double bed, the top of which was hemmed in by the only storage 'cupboards', so if you turned over too energetically in the middle of the night you crashed your elbow against them! The worst part was having next door's bathroom - and the lift shaft - in our room, hence the severe lack of space. So, do ensure that you specify that you do NOT want a room ending in 4! These rooms are certainly not of an appropriate size for 2 people - and would only suit someone a little on the deaf side! The reception staff were charming and helpful in every respect. They did try to see if an alternate room was available for us, but informed us that there wasn't one. I cannot comment on breakfast as we never managed to eat there - the breakfasting area was tiny and full the first morning, so we ate at a bar further up rue Monge on the left (les petits écoliers?) for 4e90. there is also an excellent boulangerie opposite and a good supermarket, Ed, on the other side of rue Lacépède heading for rue Mouffetard. [--] AMF

Reviews.Title: “SOft Landing at the Saint Christophe”
Reviews.Author: Abelian
Reviews.Content: A great place to land after an exhausting schedule. After a quick day in Paris and then travel to Brugge, Belgium and Beaune, Burgandy by train for four days, we stayed here for two nights. The room was large enough for a mature couple and the service was excellent. We appreciated having the internet and two TV channels in English. The bathroom was clean and the shower was large enough to bend over, which we hadn't had at other hotels. The staff spoke English for us and were helpful with directions for internet signup and local travel. I'd recommend this hotel to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Lochdubh_Travelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in September 2008. We found the location to be excellent as it's a very short walk to many dining locations and the Metro. We found the front desk staff to be very friendly and hospitable. The room was small, but it is what we expected for a room in Paris. We found the room to be clean, and that is all we wanted as we only use the room for sleeping! There is just too much to see and do in Paris! We can't comment on the breakfast as we didn't eat at the hotel, but picked up food as we walked around the city. We would definately stay here again, and would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay1
Reviews.Content: The hotel we had previously stayed at in Paris was booked on our dates so we decided to stay in a different area i.e. the left bank. This hotel stood out as the reviews on one of the websites were personally responded to by the management. This meant that they cared about their customers. Hotel was easy to find just round the corner from Place Monge Metro and Jussieu and Cardinal Limone were a short walk away. We were on the 6th floor. We could see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our window. Our room was smallish but clean and had all necessary requirements. We had breakfast included with the booking deal. The breakfast was ideal - cereal, yoghurt, bread and criossants with juice and tea or coffee. The servers were friendly. The hotel is in a quiet part of Paris just off the Rue Monge and we found no problems sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “superb location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: coops20
Reviews.Content: A real parisienne experience. The hotel is a beautiful building and the location perfect. We walked everywhere and the local area is a delight with many bars and FRIENDLY restaurants. We are an older couple and went to Paris to get engaged - it was all perfect and the hotel's ambience added to the experience. Highly recommended if you want a small, local hotel as opposed to a large modern one. Many thanks - we would return and recommend you to friends. Margaret and David

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Saint Christophe!”
Reviews.Author: dfabb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 weeks in Paris and stayed at the Hotel Saint Christophe. This is a charming little hotel that is amazingly convenient and walking-distance from so many sites in Paris, such as Notre Dame, the Pantheon, Rue Mouffetard, the Seine, etc. The staff and service were fantastic and very forthcoming with any assistance we required. As for size of the room, you have to go to Paris minus the North American expectations, unless you can afford the Ritz! We would definitely stay at this hotel again! Danny & Dante Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ShortyMom
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night at this hotel after reading many TA reviews and asking many questions on the Paris forum. This was a great hotel in a great location. It was spotless, safe, and comfortable. The best thing however was the service. Our receptionist spoke great English. We had 1 evening in Paris and told her what we would like to see. She pulled out a map and pen and paper and mapped out a complete whirlwind tour for us. She wrote down every place to walk, every metro connection, where to get on and off and put it all in order so that we made good time! We started at 4:00pm and finished about 12:30am. We ate breakfast there the next morning. It was good and all the servers and cleaning ladies were just as friendly and pleasant as could be. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Freindly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alyson B
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a weekend in Paris and stayed at the Saint Christophe hotel. Great location for food and the underground. The staff are very freindly, can't comment on the breakfast as we didn't have it but there is a bakery just over the road and great crossiants and pain de chocolate. Our room was quite small but it was a great base for exploring Paris and i thought it was good price and i would stay there again if i went to Paris in the future

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: bellmeister
Reviews.Content: We just had 3 nights at the St Christpohe and loved it. This is our 3rd trip to Paris and this hotel and location was the best so far. Very close to place monge metro, market and shops. Walk to saint germaine, pantheon. Staff were really friendly and helpful. The room were ok size for Paris, a little dated but clean and a good bathroom. My only concern was that the rooms were a little hot - they do provide a fan though. When we were there it was nice weather but not all that hot, so I am not sure if we would have enjoyed our stay so much if it had have been over 25 degrees. Apart from that though it is a great hotel and you will struggle to find better value in Paris. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cody15
Reviews.Content: Our party of three stayed here for two nights in June, and were very pleased. The location is good, within three blocks of Rue Mouffetard with many restaurants specializing in raclettes and fondues. We highly recommend the reasonably priced and charming Restaurant Assiette aux Fromages, which has a garden patio in the back. The hotel was also a 10-minute walk to Rue St. Michel and the Latin Quarter with its numerous cafes, and 15 minutes to Notre Dame. The staff were very helpful, especially finding us a private shutter service when we learned of a possible strike that could have prevented us from getting to the airport in time the next morning. It was a treat to have free internet access in the lobby. Our room was fine, with no problems. My mother's room next door to us, with extra windows and a newer bathroom, was very nice. The value was excellent and we would not hesitate to recommend Saint Christophe to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mrsbrak
Reviews.Content: I am always apprehensive when we book a place we haven't visited before in big cities like Paris or London. We've had some hits and misses. I'm happy to say that Hotel St. Christophe was a good find. The staff were friendly and quick to assist us with requests such as calling for taxis. The rooms were actually a decent size by Paris standards with fairly nice beds. I slept well, although there was a little traffic noise since we left our windows open... Not too bad for Paris though. The bathroom was very clean with modern fixtures -- that's one thing I'm picky about, so I was pleased. Breakfasts were your standard fare -- a basket of breads, cereals, yogurts and coffee -- not extraordinary, but certainly adequate and convenient. Overall, I was left with a very good impression of this hotel. Another great thing about it was the neighborhood. We had several very nice meals at a friendly restaurant down the street called Le Bistrot en Ville (has a bright orange awning). Also within walking distance is the colorful Rue Mouffetard, which has inexpensive international cuisine and all kinds of interesting shops. The Place Monge Metro stop is also nearby -- about a block away. I recommend this hotel and would likely book it again if we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this hotel very much”
Reviews.Author: Grmpmbl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Christophe in September, 2007, and we'd gone to Paris for a honeymoon trip. (We're older newlyweds; my husband had never been to Paris, and it was my first trip in over 30 years.) We liked the hotel very, very much--especially the two large windows in the room and the lovely, clean bathroom-- and we are thinking about booking here again for a trip this coming November. We had gotten a rate that included breakfast, and the servers in the breakfast room were polite and helpful. (The bakery across the street is indeed excellent, and the people there very nice and helpful.) The restaurants immediately surrounding the hotel are a bit touristy, but I think that the people at the desk would make recommendations if asked--and, of course, the hotel is conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: cheapandchic
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for 4 nights. Loveley and clean. Metro nearby and central to all attractions. Rooms on the small side but had all you need, only nitpick tea and coffee making facilities would be nice. Breakfast was great and all the staff spoke better english than my friend and I speak french. Some lovely cafes nearby too. Would recommend to anyone spending a few days in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: firstvisittoParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights in room 64, on the sixth floor up under the eaves with a sloping ceiling. Small room, as expected, but lovely and clean. Two big windows opening onto small balconies. Good for catching a nice breeze. Location was great- walking distance to most major attractions and also close to many public transit options. Nice neighbourhood to wander in. We bought breakfast each morning at a bakery across the street and walked to the Jardin des Plantes to eat sitting on a bench under the Cedar of Lebanon tree. Reception was wonderful - fluent in English and always friendly and very helpful. Appreciated the free internet usage for quick emails home. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Dependably a wonderful, reasonably priced place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tonymsrad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the past decade. It is a small, quintessentially French hotel, very charming. Very clean, excellent location. Breakfast--nothing special, but similar to most. Rooms are nice-sized. Near two metro stops.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly parisian”
Reviews.Author: UkHappy*traveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate our wedding anniversary and would definitely recommend it . The hotel was very clean and was just what we expected of a parisian hotel. The rooms were small but this is the norm in Paris. The bathroom was very clean and modern. Lovely to have full length windows that opened fully.All the staff we met were very friendly and the receptionist was very helpful. My husband had asked them to arranged some flowers for me which they had in the room upon our arrival,.They were beautiful and just what my husband had suggested. We had breakfast once and this was fine, all fresh and plenty. We loved the winding staircase. The location is perfect. Metro 1 minute away. Shops just around the corner, including a wonderful bakery. On Sunday we discovered a great little market in the square. Notre Dame is a lovely stroll away, 15 mins, and the park at the end of the road is lovely. It includes gardens and a menagerie. Didnt expect to see red pandas in the middle of Paris! All in all a wonderful trip helped by a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK thanks to location”
Reviews.Author: vvv3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is essentially average. Given the multitude of choices in Paris, it's hard to go out and recommend it, but on the other hand there are a lot of worse places out there. The big plus is the location, which is essentially next to a Metro stop, as well as close to many shops/restaurants. The proximity to the university helps there. Also, the staff is quite friendly and helpful. There is also a computer, albeit a very slow one, with complimentary internet. Once you get used to the non-QWERTY European keyboard, it can come in handy. On the negative side of things, the cleanliness of the rooms isn't exactly top-notch. Not unusual for trash cans to not be cleaned, carpets to not be vacuumed, etc. Never mind personal items being strangely moved at times. Plus, the rooms can have a musty smell. Also, the rooms are very small (Tokyo small) but maybe not that unusual for Paris. And the lack of free wifi internet is becoming more of an issue now that so many hotels include it in their rate. As a side note, the breakfast should be avoided simply b/c it's not worth the cost. You can go to one of the many bakeries in the area and get much more for less than half the price. Overall, I don't think I'd necessarily stay again, but if you perhaps get a great deal, then it might be worth trying this hotel out...

Reviews.Title: “very welcoming and helpful”
Reviews.Author: spanfan
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend break with 5 friends to the Hotel St Christophe. The area around the hotel is typically Parisian, with lots of shops, restaurants and cafes, with a wonderful market in the Place Monge. Three Metro stations within walking distance. The young lady at reception was extremely helpful - nothing was too much trouble for her, including leaving our luggage in a locked room both on the day of arrival and the day of departure. The bedrooms were quite small, but okay for short stays. Everything was very clean and nicely decorated. The only negative comment would be the small breakfast room. Tables too small for 4 people, and everyone packed in so close that it was difficult to get up and move around without disturbing others. I would certainly recommend the hotel to others, and I hope to return at some future date.

Reviews.Title: “St. Christophe has fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: olsody
Reviews.Content: We stayed at St Christophe which is in the Latin Quarter in Paris in March of 2008. It was a wonderful location; right next to the Metro, walking distance to many restaurants and night life, and Notre Dame. The rooms were nice and the elevator was hilarious! I wouldn't suggest paying extra for the breakfasts. You can get more at the pastry shop across the street for less. The bathrooms were very nice and the water pressure was to die for. The rates were a little higher than I’d like but it was well worth it. My favorite was the large tub with the gorgeous window that you could look out of while relaxing in a nice hot bath (which you will need for all of the walking!).

Reviews.Title: “Average 3 star hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: gerrysc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in February. It's pretty much as advertised. It is a middle of the road 3 star hotel with decent off season rates. Close to Metro stops and a short walk to Ile de la Cite. It is generally quiet with minimal street noise. The walls are a bit thin so you could hear other couples "activities".

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Iitu
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was a very good place for our weekend visit to Paris. We wanted to stay somewhere near to the Latin Quarter with all it's restaurants and cafes. The hotel is in a great location, near to Rue Monge with all its restaurants and walking distance to the Notre Dame and Pantheon. The rooms were clean and comfortable, although on the small side. The beds were two singles pushed together, even though we had requested a double room. The bathrooms were modern and clean. The breakfast was excellent if you like croissants and pan au chocolat as well as warm freshly baked French bread... The staff were friendly and there is a luggage room where we were able to leave our bags after check-out. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcdthemanager
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in November of last year for a girls weekend with three other friends.I found this hotel to have every thing we could want. Rooms were very clean, a little small but adequate for our stay. We faced the back of the hotel and it could be a little noisy at night. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. Location of hotel was also good and within walking distance of Metro. Also hotel was very near a square which had cafes, bars and restaurants. Area felt very safe for us girls on our own. On the whole a good choice of hotel for short stay in Paris. Would definitely recommend this hotel and I would certainly go back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find in an ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: crtgal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay. We had a wonderful experience with the Saint Christophe. After reading so many positive reviews on tripadvisor, we booked this hotel for our first visit to Paris. We were not disappointed. The rooms were clean and the bathrooms were spotless and modern. The staff was lovely and accommodating. Breakfast was included in our rate and was perfect to hold us over until lunch. The location was ideal, as it is near two metro stops and also convenient to access most of Paris' center on foot. Book a room with confidence. We are particularly fussy travelers and have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel. We would gladly stay here again and are confident to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: Rocky_Racoon76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid-week from 21 to 25 January 2008 and our experience was superb. The hotel is situated close to Notre Dame, in a good area near to some lovely bars, cafes and restaurants. It is ideally located for exploring Paris on foot, but for the less active it is also close to a number of Metro stations. The hotel staff were faultlessly helpful and friendly. The reception staff spoke excellent English which was perfect given my rusty French. We had a room on the fifth floor which was cosy but very comfortable and warm. Outside street noise was not a problem. Most importantly, the room, bathroom and bed linen were spotlessly clean. However, some travellers may wish to take note that the size of the room and the small lift which serves each of the floors might prove problematic for wheelchairs. The hotel facilities included a small breakfast room where a decent continental breakfast was served, and an internet room. To be honest, we didn't expect or require much more. All in all this hotel was a real charm and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: pfcfan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location near a metro stop and only a short five/ten minute walk to the water bus. The pantheon is also only a ten minute walk away. Plenty of bars and restaurants close by and not too badly priced Receptionist was very helpful. Rooms were clean and noise was not a problem. Breakfast was a little cramped with not enough tables for the guests however this was the only real downside. Food consisted of the usual offering of croissants and jam although cereals and fruit juice were also available. All in all I would stay here again as the location is good, the rooms comfortable and clean and the price very good for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Shebee_7
Reviews.Content: On short notice we decided to take a trip to Paris over Thanksgiving. I was looking for a place on the right bank, but Hotel Saint Christophe had the right price. Our local travel agent helped book our stay. I had been warned that some 3-star hotels are not what they seem or what we would expect. From the moment of our arrival, we knew we had booked a great hotel. We arrived just after the beginning of the train strikes. The front desk staff was wonderful in giving directions, checking our train schedule (for traveling to the Loire Valley later in the week), and helping to arrange a tour to Versailles (since the trains weren't running). I have never seen such attentive staff! The rooms were clean--mine was on the 6th floor, had a balcony, and contrary to other reviews, the room and bathroom were of good size. My sister's was on the first floor, had 2 twin beds (kind of narrow), and had an even bigger room and bathroom. BOTH rooms were quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was simple, filling, and the staff were nice--coffee, croissants, rolls, cheese, yogurt, cereal, butter, and jam. The local flea market was great! Meats, cheeses, clothes, and treats! Hotel Saint Christophe is fairly centrally located--only 15 min walk to Notre Dame, 15 min walk to Gare Austerlitz, and many shops within a 10 min walking radius. We had a wonderful stay--we will return. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little hotel!!! real gem”
Reviews.Author: lilacs109
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed in paris, we spent about $50 less per night and got a real substandard hotel... This time we were totally happy with this gem of a boutique hotel in the Latin Quarter. The location is awesome, only 2 streets from Rue Moufettard where all the restaurants are, 5 or 6 blocks from Notre Dame. Staff is like a family here and make suggestions. Rooms can be on the small side, but alllll european hotels have small rooms. We were on the street side, so there was some street noise at night. But it's awesome to have a little balcony in the morning to open the window out and smell the bakery below...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: rhumbrunner
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris five times and stayed in a different hotel each time. We will stay at the St Christophe again. The location is wonderful, walking distance to Notre Dame and the walking street, Rue Mouffetard. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We were very grateful for their help arranging transportation to the airport during the transportation strike. We highly recommend staying at the Hotel St Christophe

Reviews.Title: “Would not recomend!”
Reviews.Author: wk4
Reviews.Content: Location was not as close to Notre Dame as advertised, but still within a long walk. Some of the staff friendly and helpful. Our room was very small with old furniture, but clean. The bathroom was fine. First night the room was hot and had to sleep with the window open and the street noise was very loud. I asked the hotel staff to book and paid them directly for an airport shuttle for an early morning flight. I was in the lobby waiting for the shuttle and showed the desk clek my receipt. He called the driver in to get our luggage and help us board. To make a long story shorter I had been boarded on the wrong shuttle and therefore missed my flight and other connections. It was very expensive for me to rebook my flights. I called the hotel to see if they would at least refund my 2 nights stay to help offset my expenses. They would not accept responsibility nor would they offer anything other than a very weak apology.

Reviews.Title: “Allez le Blue! ! !”
Reviews.Author: mairtin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great few days in this wonderful city.Oct 11-16Great weather,great food,and of course a great little hotel.Catherine and moi spent five nights in the St.Christophe and we fully agree with all the positive comments made here.The hotel itself is spotlessly clean as was our room which was on the 5th floor,with a lovely view over side streets.The staff are friendly and helpful,and really made us feel welcome. A couple of tips to help you on your visit: We arrived from Dublin in CGD at 4 pm.We decided to be adventurous and take the RER to Chatalet then line 7 to Pl. Monge................................a big mistake.Chatalet is a nightmare at rush hour,even moreso with luggage!! Take a taxi its less stressful.About 40mins and 40 euro should see you to your hotel. The 47 Bus is very useful for getting downtown,it drops you back almost at the door of the hotel.Bon Voyage, we will return to the St. Christophe.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped Christophe”
Reviews.Author: Renierk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Hotel Saint Christophe at the end of September. Very close to Place Monge with its thrice weekly market and metro stop, the Saint Christophe is decidedly convenient for the Latin Quarter and central Paris. Our room was located in the front of the hotel, and with the windows open, the street noise was almost unbearable. However, with the windows closed (not an option all times of year), it was relatively quiet. The bed was extremely small, though, making it difficult for two normal sized adults to sleep comfortably. There is some storage space, but the configuration made it difficult to access. The bathroom was clean and functional, but limited space made it challenging to access toiletries for two people. Shower gel and shampoo were provided in tiny tear packages, which we found insufficient for lathering up; bring your own. The breakfast room downstairs is mundane compared to many hotels of this sort, and the breakfast (included in our rate) even more so. While we're used to small continental breakfasts, good bread or croissants make them enjoyable. The service was generally gracious and inviting. We had one small problem with housekeeping leaving only one bath towel, met with the classic French "Impossible!" when we informed the front desk, but then rapidly resolved. All in all, we found this a solid property but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “A Stellar Small Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StarLady99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at Saint Christophe Hotel Paris in Sept. 2007 and would stay again at this charming establishment near the Jardin des Plantes and the Pantheon. The staff were all friendly and helpful, spoke fluent English, and provided us with free maps. Our room (#62) was a corner unit on the top floor with a small balcony overlooking the Parisian rooftops. Although it was a tiny "chambre" it was very clean with a large marble bathroom. In the morning they served a delightful continental breakfast with the best cafe au lait, fresh croissants, yogurt, and cereal. The hotel has an elevator (which is a real PLUS when you have heavy suitcases) and free internet service from their guest computer. Just a few minutes walk up the hill you'll find crowded streets with fun dining spots and outdoor concerts. Notre Dame and the Seine is within a short stroll from the hotel.. We understand why this hotel is always full-it's a terrific homebase while visiting the city of light. Here are a couple of tips for your Paris visit: 1. When arriving by Eurostar at Gare du Nord as we did, if you have more than one piece of hand luggage, take a taxi to the hotel. With tiip and baggage fees, our fare was 20 Euros and it took just about 15 minutes even in rush hour traffic. Attempting to drag suitcases through the underground could be challenging and not worth the extra savings. 2. For an overview of Paris, buy a day pass on the open air bus which has 4 routes. The Grand Tour route takes in most of the major sites. You can hop on and off at your leisure until about 6pm which is a super way to spend a day getting familiar with the city. Price is 24 Euros. Don't buy your pass In England if you are riding Eurostar as it is much mnre expensive sold in pounds. 3. If you are visiting Versailles, either go on a pre-paid tour which is available from the hotel for 39 Euros, or buy your entrance ticket at the Bureau de Turism which is located about 2 blocks on the left before you reach the Versailles gates. Price is 25 Euros. If you wait to buy your ticket at the Versailles ticket office, you'll still pay 25 Euros, however expect a VERY long queu of an hour or more. 4. Be aware of pick pockets, especially in crowded areas. Backpacks, purses, and fanny packs are targeted and you won't even know you've been robbed until it's too late. 5. We found best rates for Saint Christophe at [--]. 6. Learn a little French and have a blast practicing. Despite what others have said about Parisians, we found everyone absolutely delightful...."tres gentilles". Bon journee et bienvenue a Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyS4
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel for a short break. Rooms were spotless, bathrooms clean and the breakfasts more than adequate. The hotel is within walking distance to many places and the metro station was one street away so very handy for getting everywhere. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Bewen
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice this year & were very impressed with the location- just where we wanted to be, central but but quiet. The decor was either right up to date & retro or still left over from the 70s. I suspect the latter. The staff were very helpful, the rooms very clean & comfortable- the lift was minute. Breakfast was good. They seemed to want to lock the front door as early as they could but always opened it promptly. I don't know how family friendly it is but it was ideal for two adults A really good find right in the Latin Quarter, not too cheap/not too pricey...good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - Great location”
Reviews.Author: takeabreak77
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money hotel in an excellent location for exploring Paris on foot, by Metro or by using the Batobus. The room was on the small side, but the facilities were of a good standard - clean, comfortable and very well serviced. Bathroom great. Everyone we met in the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The room overlooked Rue Lacepede, which added real interest without being over-noisy. Place Monge - for the Metro and market was 1-2 minutes away. Rue Mouffetard - for bars, bistros and restaurants was 3-4 minutes way - we found the top end of the street nicer - and as prices go in Paris, good value. Our first stay in Paris and we would certainly use the hotel again on this showing. Everyone we met in the city, bar one waiter at a bistro near the Eiffel Tower, was really pleasant and helpful. We'll return.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, cozy gem”
Reviews.Author: John07Indiana
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel St Christophe four times, and each time felt like returning home. The rooms are small, but clean and cozy. Breakfast is a good deal. The location is super--not far from Descartes' house, and the apartment Hemingway stayed in during The Movable Feast. The entire city is within easy reach.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the St.Christophe, and we were very pleased! Both with the hotel itself as well as the location. The room was quite typical Parisian, small but nice and clean. We found that the breakfast was excellent and the staff were very nice and helpful! Even though the Place Monge metro station was closed at the time the hotel is in walking distance to most of the Latin Quarter. We will definetivly stay there the nixt time we go to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Saint Christophe”
Reviews.Author: David012
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Saint Christophe, and we enjoyed it tremendously. The rooms are cosy and very well maintained. I saw some negative comments in some earlier reviews about the beds, but we throught they were excellent; I am 6' 3" and was very comfortable in one of the twin beds. The bathrooms are very modern and are excellent as well; ours had a "razor point" where you can plug in a US-110 volt electric device without the need for a converter. I also saw some earlier negative comments about street noise. At least during this time of year, when we slept with the windows closed, we heard nothing. We really enjoyed the breakfasts. There is plenty served, and the convenience of having the breakfast in the hotel is terrific. We didn't make many requests of the staff, but whenever we did they were extremely pleasant and responsive. It's true, as recently noted here, that the Place Monge metro station is closed for repairs. Don't be put off by that -- the Jussieu station is only a few minutes' walk away. We loved the location. It is especially nice to be so close (two blocks) to the Jardin des Plantes. My son wanted to run every morning before breakfast, and this was an ideal place for that. For us non-runners, it was a beautiful spot for a walk among the gardens and the menagerie. The hotel is also an easy walk to the Gare d'Austerlitz, which was our departure point for a day trip to Versailles. There are a wide variety of good restaurants only two blocks away on Rue Mouffetard, and this is only a 10-15 minute walk from Notre Dame. All in all, it was a delightful hotel at a good price. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: suuva
Reviews.Content: I paid an average of $150US a night for 4 nights. I thought it was a really good deal. When I got there I found out that the metro stop closest to the hotel was closed. I think that's why I got a lower rate. I think that metro opens up again in April 2007. The room was clean. The room was a nice size considering rooms in France are not big. The bathroom was small, but clean. The staff was extremely friendly and spoke English very well. The location is not as nice as Marais or the Louvre area. Still, I felt pretty safe walking to and from my hotel at night. There are a lot of places to eat if you walk a couple of blocks away. There is a bakery across the street, an open air market just a block away, and a bank with an ATM machine across the street. There are two metro lines close by so you can get to almost anywhere you want to go in 1 or less transfers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: RTaba2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in early March. Very friendly staff, and the room though small was pleasant and clean. The room included a refrigerator (part with mini-bar items which we ignored) with room for your own snack or lunch supplies. This is a small hotel - about 5 rooms per floor. The elevator is small as well (2 adults and two suitcases filled it) and the elevator is up one step from the lobby. Breakfast was very nice with bread, croissants, cereal, milk, cheese, yoghurt, plus coffee/tea/hot chocolate. The staff was also very helpful in arranging a shuttle to the airport (New Shuttle was the company) for 17 euros each if two people travel together. Check out the wonderful market a block away at Place Monge (7:00 AM-about 2:00) on Weds, Fri, and Sun according to my guide book. Fresh fruit, vegetables, cheese, jams, other foods, and some crafts and jewelry. If you are traveling to or from either airport and have very little luggage you can take the RER B train directly to Luxembourg stop, about 5-6 blocks away. I did not use this station, and don't know if it has an escalator, but most Metro stations we used required using stairs. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “It was batter in the past”
Reviews.Author: unini2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel tow years ago- loved it and recommended to our friends. This time- it was alittle bit disappointing. The room was tiny and smelly . We have no problem with litlle rooms, and even prefer the intimate feeling. But it was really too litlle! In addition, we asked, in advance, if there is a possibility, to make an early check in- we mentioned that i am pregnant in an advanced stage, and that our flight arrives early. We were answed that there will be no problem unless all the rooms will be occupied- an answer we found reasonably fair. Though, with our arrival we were told that there is no possibility to an early check in, since the hotel is full. Nonetheless, checking the hotel website, in the day of our arrival- there were 5 (!!!) double available rooms. It is true that no one owed us a thing- It is just the feeling that no gesture of good will was done. And it was the main problem during all our stay- the service was basic, and it seemed that no-one tries to halp wholeheartedly. That was the common attitude in the front desk and with the morning breakfest staff- who never smiled but looked very eager to ask the room number- giving an unpleasent feeling. So... the hotel still has its great location, reasonable price and basic but clean rooms, but there seems to be comparable possibilitis with batter attitude to the gustes.

Reviews.Title: “jewel in the latin quartier”
Reviews.Author: mcon60
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the internet having sought location advice from Trip Advisor. When travelling in France we always book Logis De France hotels as these have never disappointed. They are always lovely warm and friendly stopovers. This hotel is small but really comfortable with quite big rooms for Paris and a great en-suite. The staff are really friendly and will make calls for you and arrange trips. The hotel is close to a really exciting daily market and about 10/15 mins. walk of Notre Dame and the right bank. Breakfasts are great with croissants,chocolate croissants, yoghurts, cereal, cheese and crusty bread. Tea, coffee, water and pure orange juice are available along with jams. Be sure to go to Shakespeare and Co book shop on the bank of the Seine, a great experience. My children booked us a treat ride from the airport with ------------ and two lovely men, Vincent and Jimmy made our Paris experience with a night drive through Paris past all the sights. Magic.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KC5ITK
Reviews.Content: My moter in-law booked our rooms online without a problem. She noted that we were arriving late. Staff had no problems with our delayed arrival. The cab ride from CDG for the four of us was reasonable. Staff was incredibly nice. Tolerant of my French, but fluent in English too. Our room was on the top floor. My in-laws' room was on the fifth floor. Our bathroom was beautiful. it did not have a bathtub, but was beautifully appointed and quite large. The coffered and lower ceilings of our room made it feel a touch small for the two of us. With that said though, my in-laws room on the lower floor felt roomier and the bathtub made for an even nicer room. I would recommend a fourth or fifth floor room. Not a sixth floor room. The bedding needs to be replaced and updated as it was lackluster. The bed itself and the pillows were good though. We slept with the windows openand were quite comfortable in late September. It got noisy at various points in the evening, but that is to be expected in Paris. It didn't prevent me from sleeping. Breakfast was served in the basement and it was quite warm down there. Breakfast was functonal. Although we would stay there again, we would give a more enthusiastic review if bedding were updated and rooms were better aired out as we found all the other aspects to be agreeable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MBAX01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early October. Very convenient loaction, one block from Place Monge Metro Station, 20 min. walk to Notre Dame, great food choices (variety, quality, price) 2 uphill blocks away on Rue Moffetard. Room was small but comfortable for 2 -- in room mini bar/fridge, small desk, comfortable bed. New bathroom, great shower, plenty of hot water. Staff was friendly and extremely helpful, Continental breakfast (included in our package) was good. Only negative is no A/C -- could be uncomfortable in hot weather

Reviews.Title: “Good choice when AC is not necessary”
Reviews.Author: JVBull
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights in early September, 2006. I agree with the review, two below, "Comfortable....". We love this neighborhood, and the Contrescarpe square just minutes from this hotel. One issue to consider. Paris is noisy at night. Very few 3-star hotels have air conditioning (including this one). If you are there when it is warm at night, you will need the window open and you will hear a good deal of noise from Rue Monge all night. I would stay at this hotel again if in a cool season but would pay more for a hotel with AC if in warm weather.

Reviews.Title: “Small - and clean - is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Timberman
Reviews.Content: We only had a few days, so the central location was great. Who said the French were rude - not true! Hotel staff fantastic! Rooms small but spotless, everything worked. A great stay. One thing though; I'm over six feet tall - the beds were not my size!!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: S_Sharp
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on other reviews, so after my experience I thought I should tell people mine. Although a good location and a comfortable room I found the staff quite unfriendly. The most unpleasant thing to happen was that half of my La Prairie eyecream had been used after returning from a day of sight seeing. I don't mean to sound spoilt but I saved up for this cream as a holiday treat and half of it had been scooped out and used - it was extremely obvious. From then on I locked all of my possesions (including toiletries) in my suitcase each morning and whenever I left the room. They do advise the use of the safe but I did not think that meant face products! I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, ideally situated small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zeroo
Reviews.Content: A nice, small hotel at the Rue Monge end of Rue Lacepede - a road running up to the botanical garden, the Jardin des Plantes, and only a couple of minutes from the Palce Monge metro. The Left Bank is the place to stay in Paris if you prefer the historic, narrow streets of the Latin Quarter and the islands to the more commercial, sometimes tacky, touristy feel of the Bastille area or the institutional monumentalism of western Paris. The hotel was clean, well maintained and the staff cheerful and helpful ( all those at the reception spoke English). The room in the hotel was small (more amply proportioned people may find it, and certainly the cosy lift, a tight squeeze) but adequately equipped (small TV with BBC, mini-bar useful for keeping a bottle of wine) and had nice street views - we stayed on the third floor overlooking Rue Lacepede and enjoyed evenings sipping wine sitting by the window. The bathroom was fine with a powerful shower and efficient mixer taps. It could get hot in summer but we did not find the humdrum street noise from the open windows a problem except briefly on the Saturday night when there was a fight outside the nearby Irish bar, The Iron Bell. The boulangerie opposite and the better known Boulangerie de Monge were both great to pick something up for lunch and also check out the morning market in Place Monge.. For dinner it is hard to beat the restaurants along the Rue Mouffetard and the streets off - under E40 for a three course meal for two with a carafe of wine and coffee - and Cafe ZigZag on Rue Varlet near the Pantheon is a good place for a night cap.

Reviews.Title: “Hot but who cares - you're in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: gourmet_two
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights in Paris in July and decided to stay at this hotel due to the positive reviews it received on Trip Advisor. The hotel is quite small with a real 'family-run' feel to it. The staff were always friendly and helpful, speaking English. The room itself was quite a good size, but the bed a little small and not overly comfortable. The bathroom was a good size and the shower had great water pressure. There was no airconditioning but there was a small fan which we found quite adequate. There was a bar fridge which was handy for keeping drinks cool. With the large french windows open, you had a lovely view of the street, with all the window boxes in bloom. The latin quarter is a very nice part of Paris to stay in, with a real old Parisian feel. The breakfast room was very small and stuffy in the basement with no airconditioning and as we were in Paris during a rather hot spell, this was a little uncomfortable. Breakfast was OK, with cereal and croissants on offer even though one morning, they were out of cereal. Location of this hotel is great, within walking distance to a couple of metro stations and the Siene. Didn't find the neighbourhood noisy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, Functional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: antione
Reviews.Content: I've been to paris many times for extended visits and can say with great authority that there are many dumpy hotels there. I know because I've stayed in them mostly because of lousy per diems provided by my company. (Thankfully that has changed). People who complain about Hotel St. Christophe just don't know how bad it can really be. I once stayed down near place d'italie in this hotel that was like some modern chamber of horrors yet it was completely full because Paris was in the thick of its convention season. Let me tell you my friends - the problems I'm reading here about St. Christophe are noting in comparison to some of the hellholes I've stayed in. In any case I do concur that there is a musty smell to the rooms though most places that lack AC wind up with this type of odor. The room was serviced on time, the towels were clean, as were the sheets. The TV was functional (Though I don't have much time for that but do like to check the news before sleeping). The floor was clean, vacumed daily, the bathroom was sparkling, and all plumbing worked well with little noise (if you have been to paris before then you know that this is not a given in many paris hotels). The staff was helpful and responsive to questions. The rooms don't have those mini safes so you will need to store valuables in the hotel safe. The breakast area is clean and is about as big as any of the breakfast areas I've seen in other Parisian hotels of comparable size. Of course by US standards it is small but not by european standards. The staff has no problems if you want to take your breakfast tray to your room. The mini bar wasn't fully packed so I could buy my own water and juice at nearby stores and cool it in my room. I very much liked the large windows, which when even opened a quarter of the way open provide considerable ventilation and help cool things down. The windows have a veil in addition to the curtain that can be used to provide some additional privacy but when you are taking the shower just pull the windows closed. Also keep in mind that *many* places in Paris have no AC so don't think that this is specifc to hotel st. christophe. The locale is excellent as there are two metro stations very,very closeby. The neighborhood is refreshingly UN touristy and is located right next to Jardin Des Plantes - admittedly not the most celebrated garden in Paris but still very nice. For those who want to stay in this area you can eat closeby in any number of places. But for me the metro is so convenient I can be most anywhere pretty quickly. There is a *slight* problem with environmental noise given that some of the side streets have cafes and bars where customers hang out in the street sometimes late BUT again, this isn't unique to this hotel , paris, or many other european cities where space is at a premium and you have densely packed areas hosting residential and commercial buildings. The street that runs along the back of the hotel , rue de la clef, has a pub called "the iron bell" and towards closing time some of the drunks stand around outside for a while before going home but its not really that bad. REally it isn't. If you are the type who needs total silence to sleep then Paris probably isn't a good city to visit. That or you need to stay in one of the corporate chain hotels up on champs-elysee where you are paying $250 a night. I have no problems recommending this hotel to anyone. For me, having a clean, safe room ,responsive staff, good location , and nearby restuarants make it easy to deal with the other problems that I consider to be minor.

Reviews.Title: “Not upto expectations”
Reviews.Author: ascalapius
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site about this hotel, i expected something better. BUT really i cannot fathom WHY anyone would call this a good hotel. 1. The room- Small ( yes i know its europe) and clean BUT there was this MUSTY smell that just seemed to persist. 2. The lack of Airconditioning - This presented and interesting paradox. You could open the rather large windows BUT you let in all the road noises and of course, everyone can see you after your shower. I am not kidding about this. The temprature in the room would soar if the windows were closed. There is a small tower fan in the room that did little. NO cieling fans. 3. Breakfast - Very functional, Orange juice, tea, cornflakes, croissants, yoghurt is what you can expect. Its not the breakfast but WHERE it was served which created the problem. The basement was HOT and small. There were 6 tables in all and at best only 13-15 could fit into it. Not something i want to look forward to in the morning. The GOOD thing was the location- its next to two metros - Place Monge and Cardinal Lemoine. Lots of small bistros nearby BUt its not value for money( in my opinion)

Reviews.Title: “springtime in paris”
Reviews.Author: carrotsarered
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the hotel and had a wonderful time in paris. I would agree with most of the reviews- the hotel is small, clean and in a real- not touristy area. I watched the neighbourhood life going on through the windows as I woke up in the morning. I would say that the hotel seemed very warm and I probably would have found it too hot in the summer.It is in an ideal location for the local metro, small cafes etc up at the place de la contrascope where we ate most evenings. The room at the front was noisy but we expected that as we were in a busy capital city.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, quiet, friendly”
Reviews.Author: trav46583
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in February - the hotel is undergoing some exterior renovation but we experienced NO noise and the windows were not really blocked at all - so dont worry about that unless you stay during the week and plan to spend all day sitting inside your hotel room! Friendly staff, decent breakfast (baguettes, croissants, cereal, yogurts, etc). Down the street from huge park and about 2 blocks from Mouffetard (lots of restaurants/shops/great Sunday marketplace). Less than 3 minute walk from Metro (Place Monge) and there is another metro stop on a different line a little bit further up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parisian Home Base”
Reviews.Author: bthorn27
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for exploring all of Paris, and very reasonable rates. The rooms are clean, and the staff is friendly. The hotel does not offer many frills, and its quite possible to get a room with no view, or a less than desirable view. For frugal travelers this place is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeanr
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 4 nights at St Christophe. We had a twin room facing the street, (which was very quiet), decent sized bathroom, and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was included in the price, and was a good start to the day. The staff were great, and we liked the location. All in all, we very much enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel St. Christophe a keeper”
Reviews.Author: irishiiis
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the hotel St. Christophe off rue Monge, and we were happy we picked this hotel, based on TripAdvisor reviews. The price of $125/night included a decent breakfast, cereal, yogurt, croisant, cheese, o.j. and tea or coffee. The mattress was nice and firm, the room completely clean, the shower had terrific water pressure and lots of very hot water. The room faced the street, yet was very quiet. The Metro stop is a half block away and makes it easy to zip around Paris. We walked from the hotel to Notre Dame, the Louvre, Luxembourg Garden and many other places. My husband got sick, and the hotel helped us get a cab to the hospital. I told them they didn't need to chage the linens that day, and they said they would do it while we were gone. They were always very helpful and pleasant. With the money you save on lodging, you can gain weight at the many fantastic restaurants around the city!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant base for our Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: LesfromNJ
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our room and the staff was pleasant. This is a good location for walking in the Latin Quarter and the METRO is conviently close.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent and close to the Metro Station, which allowed easy access throughout Paris and to Versailles. My wife and I spent over a week and the hotel was very comfortable and clean, the towels and hand towels were also fine. There is a 110 volt outlet in the bathroom that can be used for shaving or recharging the digital camera, as well as a built-in hair dryer. There is local nightlife 2 blocks away with many bars and restaurants that are economically priced. We walked to the Arc de Triumph in about three hours, stopping along the way for lunch and sight seeing. The staff also helped with booking shows and dinners. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Arthur230
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the St. Christophe after having read some of the good reviews prior to our trip. The location was good but that's about the best thing I can say about the hotel. Our main reason for staying at this location was because we had heard the staff was nice to Americans. This is however not what we encountered. The Asian lady "helping" us was so rude on several occasions that we were there. I didn't feel "singled out" however because I also heard her arguing with some British visitors as well. We felt like we were inconveniencing her to have her open the baggage storage area for us after we checked in as our room was not ready yet. And don't ask her for advice about restaurants, etc around there because she acts like she knows absolutely nothing about the city. Upon entering our room, we saw that they were very tiny (which we expected so that wasn't a big deal) and opened right onto the very noisy street. Had I not had my earplugs, I would have gotten absolutely zero sleep during my stay. The room was clean but the bed (although a double bed) was so short that my feet hung off the end of it and I'm only 5'6". It was also very swayed in the middle. Be sure and take your own hair dryers because theirs hardly work at all. And unlike most European countries that have at least one English speaking channel on TV, they had zero. I felt like I was being interrogated upon checking out as it seemed like she just could not believe that "no, I did not want any of the limited items you had in the mini bar" and "no, I did not eat your breakfast that you said was free when we registered and then later said there was a charge for". The main reason we did not pay to stay and eat their breakfast was because there wasn't much to it and it was in the basement which was quite possibly at least 100 degrees. It was unseasonably warm while we were there and the air conditioner did not work in the room either. I would never plan on staying here the next time I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Bladegirl
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Trip Advisor and those of you who submitted reviews of this lovely hotel. We spent 4 nights at the Saint Christophe 21-25 September 05. Yes, the rooms are fairly small - but aren't they in most European hotels - however, the staff are friendly, the rooms are clean and the location is great. It was nice to be away from the really touristy areas and really enjoy the local Parisian life surrounding the hotel. At the same time we were only a few metres from the closest metro station to take us anywhere around town, and within a 30 minute walk of Notre Dame. Have to say that the little Pastiseries not far from the metro station have treats to die for! Would highly recommend this property and would stay there again next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mharie
Reviews.Content: This is a small, but charming hotel in an excellent location. The rooms are small, but spotlessly clean and the reception staff are very helpful. There are very good restaurants just a short walk away on the Rue Mouffetard, and the two nearby metro stations make it an excellent base.Lack of air conditioning could be a problem in summer months, though there is a fan in the room.Having paid more for worse accommodation, I shall certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: wildone
Reviews.Content: Good location (metro close,shops,markets.lots of resturaunts nearby,safe,clean comfortable,reasonable value,nice breakfast.Good Staff.

Reviews.Title: “St Christophe is fine.”
Reviews.Author: honeysusie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Christophe recently for a short Paris trip. I checked out the hotel with tripadviser first and the reviews were right. The hotel is in a good position with a metro stop just round the corner. It is situated in the Latin Quarter with lively squares and streets a short walk away. The room itself was a little small but perfectly adequate for our needs. The bathroom was spotless as was the rest of the hotel. Linen was changed regularly even though we were only there for four days. Breakfast was continental and perfectly adequate. It was quiet at night and although a little hot (There was a bit of a heatwave) the hotel provided a fan in the room. The staff were friendly and helped us with booking trips etc. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: timecop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in June for 5 nights and I was disappointed. Very, very small room, but I guess that was to be expected. You open the door and you can touch the bed, but it was clean, as was the bathroom, with adequate closet space. The only electrical outlet was in the bathroom, and I did not like the fact that there was no peephole or a chain on the door. Tiny TV, no air, but a reasonable size fan and you could open the windows, which of course let in all the street noises. I guess because of the size of the room and the fact that my bags were kind of blocking the bed, it was not made up for 2 days. Once I squashed my bags on top of each other, the bed was made. The breakfast was sparse in choices, and after the first day we left it alone. Close to metro, other attractions and dozens of restaurants 2 blocks away, try the Tire-Bouchon restaurant, 47 rue Descartes, fabulous food.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel, lots of character”
Reviews.Author: Woody01
Reviews.Content: This is a charming little hotel in a lovely area of Paris. Nice, spotlessly clean room with comfy bed and lots of storage space. We really enjoyed our stay there. If you like a quiet room I'd suggest a room to the back as the street outside is very noisy at all hours, especially if you have to open windows due to lack of air con. Really liked hotel and would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and more”
Reviews.Author: Toni05
Reviews.Content: Firstly thanks to all of you who take the time to write reviews, I spent a lot of time on the site to pick a hotel within budget but suitable for my fussy younger sister and was very pleased with this recommendation. The biggest highlight for us which probably can not be guaranteed was that our room was ready for us when we arrived at 09:30 after an early early trip on the Eurostar from London. Our room looked into a centre courtyard shared by the other buildings so absolutely no view but very quiet. The room was nothing to shout about but it was nice enough. The bathroom was small but I'd say in its defence it was a really nice bathroom by inexpensive hotel standards well laid out, totally modern, great shower pressure, clean and a nice sized shower. The staff were excellent in helping us located a place to eat - when we got back just before midnight, arranging our trip to Versailles and offered to arrange transport to the airport etc. This hotel is close to the metro and it was super easy to get around Paris. All in all a good experience.
